Reviews.Title: “Bad AC & Shower & Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: bertthree
Reviews.Content: Sleepless night in a hot room. Shower might as well be a faucet. Front desk put us in an already occupied room and then wanted to argue about it. Mattress also bad, my feet higher than my head. Finally fell asleep at 6am kutdide the covers with head at foot of bed. I can't speak for any other room in the hotel but that's room 105. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location... Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IanGBradford
Reviews.Content: Just a two blocks from 'Borbon', less from the Spanish Market , (and with parking too!), this hotel has everything! The breakfast is brought to your room, the pool is great and the staff friendly and welcoming.... what's not to like? (prices are good too!)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Henry Y
Reviews.Content: very nice room very good location THE BEST STAFF we were lost in traffic. the desk clerk guided us in turn by turn and upon our successful navigation of one way streets in heavy traffic we were greeted in the street by the valet and bellman. All this for less than we would have paid at a bargain motel ang right in the FRENCH QUARTER. What a lovely courtyard! The roon was quiet and secure.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: andyjamesgraham
Reviews.Content: just back from New Orleans and wanted to recommend this hotel to everyone. its in a great location, very friendly staff, good price for what you get. if i come back to New Orleans i would definatly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Graduation trip”
Reviews.Author: in4ed
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to the Big Easy, saying he knew of a gem down in the Quarter... This is an older hotel, one you wouldn't notice because there are no flashing signs or markers. But the courtyard was great, the pool very inviting. The staff extraordinary.... the room keys are actually metal and not those plastic strip cards.... He asked for a pool side room and although it was small, WHO EVER STAYS IN THe ROOM IN NEW ORLEANS?? The room opened to the pool, approximately 3 steps away. Wonderful. A light breakfast is delivered to the room as well, your choice of goodies.....

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: E W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. Close to everything! Great place for groups. We were able to get most of our rooms to open to the pool/courtyard area and was just a great place to socialize before going out.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: Everyone (but one) that worked at the hotel was great! Very personable and attentive. The room was charming and the outside pool wonderful! The only problem we encountered was the last morning when the young man that brought us breakfast was rude and acted as if he didn't want to work. He told me to "make sure I left the tray out before 11. Don't forget." That mornings breakfast was pretty awful too. Besides the last morning terrible employee, the place is an ACE for the reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Car trouble and fate brought us here!”
Reviews.Author: DonnafromIowa
Reviews.Content: My husband , 6 yr old son and I found ourselves with an overheated car as soon as we hit the Quarter so we pulled into their hotel parking lot. It was abolutely pouring down rain so I ran into the lobby with the help of one of the many sweet housekeepers and Greg the bellman immediately gave me a dry towel and an umbrella. Dan at the desk set us up with a room and the rest is history. We Absolutely LOVED every bit of our experience at the Chateau. Although I have visited Nola several times in past yrs, it was my hubby's first time and I feel so blessed to have broken down here! The place is full of charm and very very well kept for a 275 yr old property! I have never stayed so close to the action yet felt so far from it in the beautiful courtyard. We met such wonderful fellow travellers and ended up in some lively discussions (Ted and Mack) by the pool for breakfast and before bed. We have found our new home away from home with these wonderful people. And if you read this post Sarah please let Dan and the gang know we are headed back to Iowa and the car is running fine. It was fate, pure and simple. See you next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Special Place”
Reviews.Author: LauraB77777
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Hotel is where we got married. After looking at EVERY quaint hotel in the French Quarter, we knew immediately that The Chateau was our special place. The staff, especially Sarah, was and continues to be awesome! We often return for weekend getaways and to see our Chateau "family" even though we live less than an hour away. This hotel is not 5 star; however, it is quaint and nice settled in a great location to everywhere one would want to venture out to in the Quarter. Parking is convenient and affordable....hard to find in the Quarter. We would not think about staying anywhere else! We have made great memories here and will continue to do so in the future....a little hint....check out the suite across the street from the main hotel....super nice! Jack and Laura - Mandeville, LA

Reviews.Title: “Our experience at the Chateau Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rita M
Reviews.Content: I liked the courtyard with the pool and that some of the rooms opened to this area. We were in a party of 15 couples so that part was good, but our room in particular was down a hallway on the first floor. The part I did not like was that the rooms were HOT!! I was never cool the entire time we were there. We asked for a fan, some of our friends got them, but we were told they did not have any left. It would be a better place to stay when the weather is cooler since the air does not work well. The rooms were not as clean as I would like either, and everything was really old. The carpet was worn out. A reno in much needed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Kind People, & Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: NicLikoudis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed July 19 - July 24 and our only complaint is the shower water pressure is sadly lacking. Everything else was great! The staff is very friendly and accommodating (thanks again to Sarah for printing my last minute tour reservation for me). The room was clean, slightly outdated however, there were workers on the premises making repairs and updates (very polite, quiet workers). I found the people of New Orleans in general, to be very friendly and never lacking in manners. It was a great change of pace from life in Chicago.The Chateau Hotel is a perfect starting point to a magical vacation. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: safed321
Reviews.Content: Seriously, unless you are an 18 year old on springbreak with an alcohol level of 0.99%, do not stay here. The place is filthy. The first night I was placed in room #106, a small hovel near the generator that sounded like heavy construction was underway. The dirty, moldy shower backed up 3 inches of dirty water, I had to stand on the ledge and shower in order to not stand in it. The toilet didn't flush, the closet had a small panel that had fallen off which exposed a bug filled inner walling area of some sort that I was afraid rats could come out of, the rug was filthy and tattered, the corners were filled with dust and filth, the walls were paper thin, I heard my (unfortunate) neighbors as if we were in the same room. When I offered my complaint to the head guy at the desk, he had a hissy fit and told me he could not fix it until the next day. Told me I was the first ever to complain about the noise. I was "upgraded" to a better room #225 the next day, but that too had filthy, tattered carpet. The entire hallway smelled of urine and smoke. The first day in that room I had no toilet paper and waited 3 hours and multiple calls to get it.The toilet had poop stains and when I asked the maid to clean it, she did so with no gloves!! Man, I could go on and on but I won't. I would rather forget this part on my three night trip to NOLA. I have no comparison to other hotels in the area, but I paid $101 per night, and there has to be something better than this dive! Positives: It is right in the heart of the French Quarter, but so is the sidewalk, and frankly, that's about on par with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - had no problems at all!”
Reviews.Author: mississippi_saint
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, his brother, his brother's girlfriend, and I all stayed at the Chateau Hotel for 2 nights (June 30 and July 1). I've been home since Monday and I literally have been in a depression ever since. I did not want to leave. We arrived earlier than planned on Saturday - no big deal! One of our rooms were ready and the other wasn't, so the friendly employee parked our car for us and took our bags to the available room. Didn't bother us a bit, we were ready to go out and play anyway :)... When we came back, the 2nd room was ready and we got settled in. We each had a King room. Perfect size for 2 people. Everything was clean, cable TV worked great, refrigerator was a wonderful touch, coffee maker was my lifesaver in the mornings! No complaints whatsoever about our rooms - we weren't in them much, they served their purpose, plenty of space for us, clean, and nice functioning amenities. The rooms are cleaned daily and you are given fresh new linens, towels, etc. Breakfast is complimentary - you have a little sheet and you're given options to choose from and you choose around what time you want your breakfast delivered to your room, along with a free newspaper every morning. Lovely little touch; I really enjoyed that. The pool area was nice and clean. We swam on the 2nd night and it felt great to cool off from walking in the sun all day long. (The pool is a saltwater pool, by the way). There is an ice machine and a Coke vending machine in the courtyard also which was super convenient for us. Our rooms were located on the first floor, close to the street and at times we could hear street walkers talking or music or the clacking of the buggy rides, but we didn't mind. This is New Orleans - soak up the sounds!!! The location is perfect. One block from Decatur (MS River), just a VERY short walk down the street to Jackson Square and St. Louis Cathedral, and 2 blocks from Bourbon Street. Awesome, awesome, awesome location! We felt very welcome and safe and secure at all times. The gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. My boyfriend and I are currently trying to plan our next trip to my beloved New Orleans (yes, this soon) and Chateau Hotel will be our #1 choice. If you are looking for five-star absolute luxury, maybe this isn't the place for you. But if you're looking for a laid back, comfortable stay with an excellent location and super nice staff for a good value - give them a try! I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A little GEM on a street corner”
Reviews.Author: Dado 1
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from what was a very good holiday, we started in Florida and drove the 750 miles up through the different states to New Orleans but the only bug bear was it was 750 miles of very little scenery other than pine forests so it did get a little boring, We stopped off in Panama city beach on the way up and I will write about that on my other review. when we arrived at New Orleans we did not know where to stay so we stopped off at the information center and they were extremely helpful. They gave us the choice of 4 hotels that had vacancies but it is difficult to find them even though the french quarter is only a few blocks square but they are all on one way systems so we ended driving by it and then circling round again. We were pleasantly surprised at the cost of a King room (under $200 for 2 nights) and the room was just great, lovely soft bed own little balcony through the french doors, in fact the only thing we did not like was the attitude of some members of staff, we did not realize that if we required breakfast around the pool area we still had to put the notice on the door saying we wanted breakfast. The lad said he would get us breakfast but I should not forget his tip for doing this, being typically British we do not tip when people ask for tips so he was very rude, we then got our breakfast and I had a dirty cup so I asked the young boy to change it and he just swilled it under the tap so I did not bother with the tea next day the cups were not clean so we we went to a cafe and had tea and coffee there. but please do not let this little hiccup stop you from stopping at what is a very nice Hotel with very clean rooms and charming people on reception and the boy who parked our car was a very nice lad who was very helpful- be aware though that you cannot just park your car anywhere as they strictly enforce the parking due to the narrow streets. just a little info on New Orleans, the main street where all the entertainment takes place is Bourbon street and they have some very good entertainers along the street to stand and watch but also down one end there are some seedy places offering less than a welcome for families (if you know what I mean!!) but again bearing in mind some people want that sort of thing. The one thing I would say is find this little restaurant called "GUMBO SHOP" on Saint peter street as this does what we thought was some of the best Gumbo food which of course is a must to try when in New Orl. along with the Cat fish. Lastly we had a ride on the Steam boat "Natchez" 2 hours on a steam paddle boat was well worth the $25 each we paid and they did not rip you off for drinks etc on board. all in all I really do think the Chateau Hotel was one of the best we had stopped in as we traveled across America. I would rate the room as 9 out of 10 for position and value for money

Reviews.Title: “a good value in the quarter”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyRoad84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends in early May during Jazzfest. We live very close to New Orleans and visit many times a year. We have stayed at many hotels in the Quarter and on Canal. The Chateau Hotel was a very good price (even during Jazzfest) and in a great location. The staff was friendly. The parking situation is great here and affordable. The rooms are charming old New Orleans which I love. Many old hotel buildings in New Orleans have very small rooms, but I found this one to be very comfortable. You can find larger, more modern rooms in New Orleans, but they won't be in this price range. Plus I like staying in the historic romantic buildings. Our room was located right on the street, but noise was not a problem. The courtyard was beautiful. We saw many guests enjoying the breakfast room service, but we did not take advantage of it ourselves. As far as cleanliness, in this price range in New Orleans, it is a little above average. Unless you're staying in a four or five star place in New Orleans, then there's always a little give and take. Overall a great value for the location and hotel amenities. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and quaint!”
Reviews.Author: ArmyMOMLA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 25th Anniversary in March 2012. We went to several areas and one of out destinations was New Orleans. What a great time we had. We stopped at the visitors center in New Orleans and found out about this hotel with a great discount. The ladies there are extremely nice, also.This hotel is so close to everything. Two blocks to the river, and one block from Bourban St. They also have valet parking, serve breakfast to your room at the time you specify, and you choose from their menu what you want for breakfast. Room is very quaint with antique furniture. There is a courtyard with pool that is enjoyable to sit out by. Let your cares slip away!! We loved staying here and would go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Old New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Nedntxk
Reviews.Content: In my many visits to New Orleans, I never had such a unique room. My room opened directly onto the sidewalk through a shuttered door. I've seen many of these old buildings, but had never ventured into one. The room was small, tidy, and outdated - but that's part of the ambiance. Really cool layout with a beautiful courtyard, several balcony rooms on Chartres, an adjoining cottage, and CHEAP VALET PARKING (many of the boutiques and guest houses have NO parking) in a lot just across the street. Creole cottage rooms on the sidewalk have optional adjoining rooms on the courtyard side. If you want glitz, try the Ritz. If you want to take a trip back in history, you can do it here. Cool place, nice staff, great location. It's easy to recommend this one for travelers with historic tolerance for the ancient structures.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Remi47
Reviews.Content: If you are driving into New Orleans, stop at the Louisiana State visitors center at the roadside stop. They have great discount coupons and free phones for making hotel reservations. These discounts are only available if you have the coupon. Our hotel, the Chateau, on the corner of St. Phillip and Chartres had free parking and very reasonable room rates...$69 with the coupon, $79 other nights. Nicely maintained pool. Walking distance to everything. Parking, if available, at other hotel, was $28 or more a night! Lots of smokers in the courtyard around the pool, unfortunately. Other than that, and a slightly moldy smell in the room, we liked it. We'd return. Lillian, at the desk, gives great advice on restaurants and music. Listen to what she says.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: 21Tanya
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for comfortable accommodations in a great French Quarter location at an affordable rate, this is the place for you. My priorities were a clean room, comfortable beds, AC, pool and prime location. No other place in the Quarter beat the Chateau in terms of price. This place has traditional spring mattresses, if that is important to you. Our closet space was limited by a mini-fridge, but we were able to work around it. The daily continental breakfast is a nice touch, but don't expect a gourmet selection. My friends and I loved walking through the quaint courtyard every morning and coming home to an air-conditioned room every afternoon. We cooled off in the pool or napped before getting ready for our nights out. The Chateau is across the street from Irene's restaurant, something of a local Quarter institution. It's down the street from the Beauregard-Keyes House and the Ursulines convent, both worth touring.

Reviews.Title: “In the Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonWhaley
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, friendly and very helpful! The room was small but affordable for being in the quarter. The carpet was not real clean but everything else was. If you are wanting to party and hang out in the quarter this is the place. Great places to eat and fun things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with perfect location for the French Quarter & onsite parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: mspunk3
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay. A very quaint hotel with a beautiful private courtyard. Rooms are smaller but decent size considering everything in the French Quarter is so compact. They have everything you really need in a room. A shower w/a small tub, a mini fridge, two nightstqnds, a dresser, a desk, a tv & a closet. The bed was very comfortable and our room was very clean. The local newspaper at your door every morning & a small beakfast delivered to your room in the morning if you would like. Onsite valet parking for $20 per day which is cheap compared to the other parking in the area. Hotel staff was very friendly and helptul. Will definatly stay here when we go to New Orleans again. Great times here!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, violated and nasty”
Reviews.Author: Irene S
Reviews.Content: During Spring break 2012 had confirmed reserved room, not multiple rooms. Came back the evening before departure to find room vacated without prior notice or permission. Found suitcases, which had been moved to another room, packed willy nilly with dirty clothes and street shoes packed in on top of clean cloths. Brochures we collected from the different art galleries we visited were not to be found. Never in our lives have we ever felt so violated by such unwarranted action. Even in communist Russia we were always better treated.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was good”
Reviews.Author: amandalaren
Reviews.Content: I went to vist the French Quarter for the second time and brought a friend with me to see it for the first time. I stayed in this hotel previously because I enjoyed the location of it. It's out of the noise, the lights, and the smell of other more party-going areas. I was very excited to stay on the second floor this time (I didn't even notice the stairs last time) and when I opened the door I was pleasantly surprised to see two very adorable beds that had the four poster feel to them (with two posts instead at the head) and though there was no window because of where we were in the building it was still nice. Could have done with another light as we only had one table lamp in the corner but we just turned the bathroom light on. The breakfast the first morning was about 3 hours late, but It's just breakfast. The other days it was on time and great. The people at the desk were helpful and kind and the workers as well always said hello. If you're looking to stay close in the quarter to Jackson Square this is probably the best location for the best price. I called to many other hotels hoping that this would be the cheapest and not booked and it was! I was so excited. The tv was also not working most of the time, but we were on vacation so we didn't need it much at all. There are many nice places to eat and souvenir shops close by to visit. You can catch the streetcar and sit on the wharf next to the river as well with a 5-10 minute walk. Its great. And don't forget to swim in the pool before you leave. Will stop by again, hoping that the huge cockroach we found on the last night will stay gone. They are the misquitos of the south so I can't complain. Recommended stay for sure. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to New Orleans a SUCCESS!”
Reviews.Author: luvablkate
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I escaped to New Orleans to celebrate both of our upcoming 50th birthdays. This was our first trip to New Orleans. I did a lot of searching, reading reviews, and of course checking out tripadvisor. Well, we decided on Chateau Hotel for several reasons: it was central to everything, had old charm, was medium range priced, and the reviews were good and where they were not the hotel management explained why and how the concerns were handled. Well, we just got back and had an amazing time. Dan at the front desk made us feel welcome the minute we walked in the door, and so did the bell hops, etc. Our room was beautiful, well appointed and spacious. The hotel itself is very French Quarter, unique, has a beautiful pool, and a nice continental breakfast which was a great start to our mornings. Here are our notes and tips. If you can, ask to be housed in the main set of buildings. If you like the nightlife and noise - choose an outer room, if you want a little more quiet and privacy - go for the 2nd level or inside on the courtyard facing into pool. They have a 4 room building acorss the street which we were housed in, I would have much preferred the other main building although our room was beautiful. We faced to the street and across from us was a 24 hour neighborhood bar - excellent Bloody Mary's. But it did get busy and noisy so we never opened our shades. Another thing, I think since the ventilation and air conditioning was added later (historical building) we would get cigarette smoke circulating into our room from time to time from one of the other rooms. It did bother us the smell never saw any smoke FYI. The front desk brought in a large deodorizer which helped some. And, when the A/C kicked on it dissipated it as well. So, if you plan to spend a lot of time in the room or have allergies to smoke - I wouldn't stay in this room - 156. Other than that - we loved it. I wore earplugs for 2 nights just to make sure I could sleep, my girlfriend did not wear any and she slept fine as well. I think noise level will vary based on the week you are visting i.e. festivals, and the night life. This truly was a perfect spot. We walked all over town (would not recommend a car - do not need it). We walked to Riverwalk Shopping center and Aquarium, the edge of downtown and Harrahs, along the pier, to Bourbon Street, all over the French Quarter, walked to dinner to both Broussard's and NOLA, and walked down to the big park with the museum buildings but I don't remember the name of the park (I think Armstrong). I highly recommend Chateau Hotel. NOLA was awesome, food was great at Broussard's (old fashion charm), Cresent City Cooking was great, and highly recommended www.Strayboots.com for walking scavenger hunts that take you through the history and sites of New Orleans. We will be back. Our trip couldn't have been better. Oh and take the taxi to and from airport - best way to go rather than the van to hotel. Traveled April 20th to the 23rd, 2012. Some fun notes - Cafe Du Monde was excellent and a fun stop, St. Louis Cathedral a must, Cafe Maspero - best Bloody Mary's, Coyote Ugly - great/friendly people and they had a free Crawfish boil while we were there (it was huge), great artictic places to stop and shop, cooking class at Cresent City Cooking should be a must, and just walk around as much as you can. What a wonderful city, but beware when walking around - the streets and sidewalks are old and riddled with cracks, dips, holes, etc. And, the life is eclectic and at sometimes very sad (poverty). Hotel Mgmt. - You need to look at the toilet in this room - it wobbles from the wall, the night table between the two beds needs a leveler on one foot, and the smoke issue - other than that perfect (these are just small maintenance issues). Oh, and I am mailing your keys too. Kathy N. & Deb D.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!! Everything we needed, no frills, great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela J
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice now. First was in November 10', for our 20 year anniversary. My husband or myself had never been to NOLA, and just happened upon the place online. We had an awesome balcony room, very clean, old, but clean. The old is to be expected, it's NOLA and it's a historic area. The balcony view was awesome, even caught a great view of a wedding coming by. Perfect!! Staff was very friendly and helpful, they did recommend some tourist info, but never felt like I was being pushed to go there. Temperature was never an issue. It's the south so of course we used the heat and air cond, during the same weekend. Our second trip we made with another couple, we had adjoining rooms in the courtyard area, near the pool. Rooms were very nice, we were able to open the adjoining door and visit with our friends, during the brief times we were in the room. The only issue we had, was with the air conditioning in our friends room, which quit on the second day we were there. This trip was in August 11" so it was sweltering. The hotel was full on this day, and another room was not available until the next day, so we opened our adjoining door and let the cool air in during the day so it wasn't totally unbearable at night, and the hotel moved them in a new room for our last night there as soon as it was vacant. No problems, at all even adjusted the price. The funny thing was they were given the exact room my husband and I stayed in on our first trip. Again the staff was very friendly, not overbearingly so but friendly. Offered advice on places to eat and site seeing. The hotel is great for us, guess it depends on what you are looking for. To us it was quaint, perfect in location, and had everything we needed. Planning a trip back with our friends in the fall, and planning on staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: LarsMorch
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated if you're on your first trip to NOLA, walking distance to a lot of sights - and sounds - so leave your car at the parkinglot, and walk. Special house with a great court yard, which has a small swimmingpool, breakfast delievered to your rooom when you want it. Free Wifi in rooms (but it actually works best in the courtyard), Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Price, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at the Chateau Hotel. Our room was located in a building across St. Phillip from the reception area. It was roomy with two queen beds and an exposed brick wall, a good size closet, and the bathroom was also adequate. All of it was clean. The breakfast was continental and delivered at a specified time to your room. They do not have dining facilities. We were in a quiet location, although I understand that the rooms on the street can be noisy. The price was fair. We had no negative experiences here and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a pity!”
Reviews.Author: Ella H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and has great potential. Some things about it are pleasant, such as breakfast (with the possibility of having it in the room at no extra charge) and the daily local newpaper, both included in the price. The courtyard is also very nice. I stayed at the hotel in February 2012 with my husband for four nights. The first night we were given a room (# 115) at the street level, with no possibility of opening the windows, which is quite common in the French Quarter, due to the structure of the houses and safety reasons. However, the bad part was that, since the windows did not have clear curtains, but only thick ones, in order to enjoy our privacy, we had to have the thick curtains pulled, so the room was completely dark and we could not enjoy any natural light. Also, the only way to change the air in the room was to have the main door open, which, again, meant to have no privacy whatsover. This kind of room should just not be sold, not in these conditions, until they provide it at least with some clear curtains, that allow natural light to come in while still enjoying the privacy one expects in a hotel room! The kind gentleman at the reception changed our room the following day, and gave us one with balcony. This time we had plenty of light, fresh air and privacy. The room itself had a great potential, but the old carpet, curtains and towels and the its smell of old took a lot away from what could otherwise have been a very pleasant stay. What a pity! When we checked out, the Reservation Manager took only $20.00 off the final bill, after I complained about the first night, and explained that some previous guests had ripped off the clear curtains in the room we had gotten the first night. How does it really take to replace curtains? The gentleman that was at the reception the last two days also does not seem to be the right person for this kind of client-oriented job. Again, what a pity! The hotel could be such a gem!

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN NEW ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINGDINERS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here many times. It is perfect! 2 blocks from Bourbon St and 2 blocks from the river front. We have also stayed in the condo they own across the street. It is great for 2 couples. Huge living room, dining room, 2 bedrooms. Excellant. The night before we had to check out, I had imbibed a little too much at the Blacksmith's Tavern. When the maid came the next morning, I jokingly asked if I could sleep a few more hours before having to leave; she said "baby, you just stay in that bed and I'll be back in a few hours"...How great was that?

Reviews.Title: “The French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Holloway2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chateau Hotel 1001 Rue Chartres, New Orleans, La. THe service and staff were wonderful, friendly and professional. Breakfast served to you daily with the paper in a comfort garden stay courtyard. I would recommend this stay for couples and families alike. We will be back next year for sure. Thank you Chateau for the greatest stay. Mr & Mrs. Holloway

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price Is Right, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: Knizzle
Reviews.Content: This little gem is 2 blocks from Bourbon Street, about 3 blocks from Jackson Square, 3 blocks from Cafe Du Monde, 1 block from the art galleries on Royal Street -- yeah, it's pretty much in an amazing location in the quarter. It's at the corner of Chartres Street & St. Louis. When I go to NOLA, I like to divide my day into thirds: Part 1 is breakfast & light shopping, then back to the room to drop off the bags, use the restroom and rest my feet for 30 minutes. Part 2 is off to another activity and lunch - then back to the room for the whole resting of the feet/restroom thing. Part 3 is dinner & nightlife and then back to the room to sleep. So the Chateau Hotel is perfect for this type of traveler ... someone who just needs a home base. Upsides: They let me check in at 9AM because my room was vacant. Major plus! The front desk is friendly and informative. They have a free continental breakfast and get this - if you're too lazy to go down & get it, you can fill out a card and hang it on your door knob and they'll bring your selections to your room at the time you indicate on the card FREE. Loved this! They have free ice, in-room refrigerators and a soda machine onsite. Beds passed my thorough bed bug inspection (sheets, mattress, box spring, mattress cover, pillow cases, etc.).Overall, I felt safe here. Downsides: OMG, noisy! The staff slams stuff around in the halls and in the courtyard at all hours of the day & night. Flapping garbage bags, vacuuming, squirting sidewalks, squawking on their walkie-talkies/cell phones, and other sounds that I couldn't identify. The paper boy drops the newspapers at each doorway at 5AM ... thump, thump, thump, thump, thump, thump, thump. The TVs are from the early 70s and include the static problems of that era too at no extra charge. The water pressure is equal to that of a kinked hose and the rooms have that "we used to let people smoke in here" aroma. No temperature controls - you have to go their preferences on this. Bottom line: Hey, I paid $89 a night. I got a killer location and a place to store my crap and rest my head. That's more than fair. I'd stay here again -- and I recommend it to you if you can look past a few imperfections in exchange for an amazing location and great rates. Just get some ear plugs, a bottle of Fabreze and you'll be golden.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Teerex51
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent: Chartres Street in the French Quarter. You're just seconds away from the Mississippi, Jackson Square and the CafÃ© du Monde. Rooms are reasonably large and the staff very friendly and helpful. One notable ecxception was an elderly gentleman at the reception who, for reasons entirely his own, was extremely unfriendly. Still, being in the heart of N'awlins was worth the temporary aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Perfect for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: klv82
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans for the first time in January 2012. I booked through Priceline primarily for the cost and location. You are about two blocks from Jackson Square, three from Bourbon Street, and about four from Frenchmen Street. Prior to our visit (yet after we booked), I noticed several reviews online regarding Chateau Hotel's poor quality, particularly regarding cleanliness. As someone who is a bit of a cleaning nut, I assure you that our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. It is basic, however, and on the small side. But if you plan to spend the majority of your stay exploring the city, this wasn't a negative for me. The front desk was very polite and helpful. I felt safe in the hotel, although there are no lock boxes in your room - I did not leave valuables. My only complaint is the noise level of the cleaning staff. They began cleaning around 8am, with no concern for sleeping guests. Overall: Safe, comfortable, clean, quiet. Great place to stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Basic old hotel buildings near the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: johndt41
Reviews.Content: After being so rudly treated last year by a staff member of the Place d' Armes hotel I looked for another hotel near the heart of the French Quarter for my 3 week stay. Chateau Hotel is 2 blocks from Jackson Square at the corner or Chartres and St Philip Streets. This is a basic hotel made up of some 19th (and possibly 18th) century buildings surrounding a large courtyard with a swimming poor and a much smaller courtyard. All the buildings are at least 2 stories with some having 3. I got a room entering on the courtyard next to the swimming pool. A breakfast of toast, muffin or roll with juice and coffee or tea can be ordered which will be brought to your room at your specified time costing nothing except tip. My maid service was very timely which I liked. When I got back around noon from my morning jaunt the room was always clean and made up. The reception and cleaning staffs were polite. The hotel does offer parking but there is no restaurant. The furnishings were old and drab with a lamp that didn't work (there always seems to be one in these hotel rooms) but I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Cute accommodation, very suited to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Karly B
Reviews.Content: Overal I was rather impressed with the accommodation at the Chateau. The hotel was in a great location but still enough distance from Bourban street to not be affected by the noise. The bed was extremely comfortable and the breakfast in the morning was one of the better we had across America. The only gripe I have is manager woman that works on the front desk was a little rude. When trying to explain something she just talked over the top of me everytime. All the other staff were great, so polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, smelly, loud.”
Reviews.Author: mash w
Reviews.Content: This place looks nothing like they make it look online. It is loud, feels and looks dirty, and the water pressure in the shower is terrible! Do not use body wash it will take you an hour to wash it of! The free breakfast they offer is a choice between a cup of coffee or a glass of orange juice. Did I mention it smells like old people and kind of like a sketchy night club. All the homeless people smelled way better. So with all of that said I must also add that for what it is it is way overpriced $268 for two nights for a king size bed with rats under it is way overpriced. I think I'll go sleep in the park a few blocks away instead of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Codytravels
Reviews.Content: Non vacuumed floors, wear shoes to shower, bugs and nasty workers. For the price, not worth it, even factoring in the location. Take a cab to the quarter and stay some where you won't catch a disease!!

Reviews.Title: “Request a courtyard/indoor room”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethLilly
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found this hotel less than a week before our stay, so we were worried that it wouldn't be nice. It seemed fine when we checked in, but then the bellman led us to a door on the street that opened up into our hotel room. I would have never guessed a hotel room was behind the large door/shutters. The room itself was fine, however being 23- and 24-year-old women in a strange city, we felt a little vulnerable. It was rather loud between all the drunken relevry from nearby Bourbon Street, passing pedestrians and horses' hooves clopping on the street. One night when we were getting ready to go out to bars, a passerby banged on our door and scared us. I guess they were drunk and heard girls laughing behind the doors. Because of that incident our first night, it scared us when one of the employees banged on our door because we hadn't picked up our complimentary breakfast in the lobby. When he knocked (if you could call it that), he didn't announce who he was. So we hesitated before opening the door. He said that they had called our room phone and we hadn't picked up. Then we checked the phone and it wasn't plugged into the wall, which was even less reassuring in the case of an emergency given our location on the street. On the second morning of our stay, we also had a rude encounter with an employee. The maid failed to leave a card to hang on the door requesting breakfast, so we picked one up in the office after we woke up. The receptionist told us to fill it out and hand it to a man working off the courtyard. When I approached him and asked him if it was too late to have him prepare breakfast, he repiled "I don't need any attitude." I was being polite, so that caught me off guard. My friend and I both pointed out that we were merely asking and not giving him attitude. I am a New Yorker and thought that was a pretty rude! We stuck around the courtyard for a few minutes and he brought out our breakfast right away and was polite then. Maybe he was just having a bad morning, but it really caught both my friend and I off guard. If it wasn't for the location of our room, I would have been satisfied with our hotel stay. However, the location did cause several problems for us. The person who my friend booked the hotel with over the phone didn't say that the room was on the street. If we knew that, we would have requested one off the courtyard instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful building, but lacks good service”
Reviews.Author: allovertheplace11
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 3 other women on our yearly trip. Three of the four of us are teachers, so we're always looking for affordable places to stay. The Chateau Hotel is certainly one of those places! It was in an amazing location, near Bourbon St (we didn't care too much about this), and only a couple of blocks from Cafe Beignet (that's what we cared about)! The outsides of the building(s) were beautiful!! We were all super excited when we got there. The room wasn't anything write home about, but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, so it worked fine for us. There were some cleanliness problems the first day, hair in the bathroom, the carpet in the room could use a good cleaning, and there was some trash left over from previous guests. It wasn't as bad as it sounds, and they fixed it the next day. My problem with the hotel is with its service. I talked to four different people at the front desk, all but one were very short with me and not too friendly. The only front desk person who I felt cared about our stay was the man I talked to at check-out. The worst part was breakfast. It was included in our rate and was suppose to be delivered to our room. Now, I mentioned that three of us were teachers, we are very careful with our money (please remember this when you read these comments). The first day we didn't get our breakfast, we had to call down about it and then pick it up ourselves. The second day we received a call from the breakfast guy basically saying, "Good Morning. Your breakfast will be up in about 10 min, TIPS ARE APPRECIATED." Needless to say, we were not happy about that. I called down and asked if I could pick up our breakfast (we didn't want to tip someone that tells you to tip). We were allowed, but told to bring everything back to the kitchen when we were done. We did. The next day, we received the same call. We were all super tired and noone wanted to go down and get breakfast, so we just had the guy bring it up and tipped him, HOWEVER, we were still asked to bring everything back to the kitchen when we were finished!!! We were paying guests and should not have had to work. Luckily the last morning there was someone else working and it went smoothly. When I talked to the desk about it they said the guy was new and they'd talk to him about it. It was just aggrivating. The bell staff was VERY friendly and nice! So, if you're not too overly concerned with service, this is a wonderful place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Motel with New Orleans Flavor”
Reviews.Author: Rustler2010
Reviews.Content: The Chateau always looked interesting as we passed it during our trips to the Mardi Gras, but it was always impossible to get a reservation there as it is booked well in advance. We did stay there over the summer. We had a front, street side room, nice/average hotel room with a long, narrow bath, but then New Orleans is know for it's quaint, tight bathrooms. The courtyard pool was welcoming at the end of each day in the hot New Orleans summer weather. The room was clean and we had no hotel issues. Valet parking in an old secured warehouse across the street although the driver allowed us to self park. We parked and never used the car until our departure. Great location, pleasant service. Not a quaint B&B, but not your average highway chain motel either. It has a old New Orleans flavor and we were satisfied and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great old style hotel in perfect vieux carre neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: SurfOrlando
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel ... have been there twice. Free AAA parking and a light free breakfast are nice, but cafe du monde is only a few blocks away for beignets and coffee. The place exudes character; the rooms are somewhat dated but have good ambience. Rates are reasonable. I am looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for tourists”
Reviews.Author: A2Z06
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. In the French quarter but on a quiet street. Beautiful old style hotel with great courtyard. The breakfast is small but it is enough to get you started. Being able to have it in your room or the courtyard is a nice touch. The rooms are old but have good character and are clean. Could not recommend this hotel more!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: porelly
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Chateau Hotel for my 3rd trip to New Orleans. I decided on this hotel because I wanted to stay in that part of the Quarter, closer to the Marigny area. And the location was perfect as Frenchman St was just a short walk away, but I was still close to Jackson Square and Bourbon St. This is not a 5 star/high class hotel with a bunch of amenities. If this is your style, then this hotel is not for you. Yes, the hotel could use some updating, but if you want good value for money, the Chateau Hotel is a fine choice. I had a queen bed room with a shared balcony over looking the courtyard. The room was small in the sense that their wasn't a lot of floor space, but it didn't feel small because of the very high ceilings. The bathroom was a good size, and felt even larger because of the wall to wall mirror. They have pedestal sinks which look very nice, but aren't practical for a hotel because there is no counter space. I ended up putting a towel on the toilet lid to use as a counter. Small annoyance, but manageable. My room also had no bathtub, just a large built in tile shower. The rooms do have small fridges, which is a big plus for me as a lot of hotels do not offer fridges anymore (or charge you more for your room to have one), but they had it in the closet. I mentionned that there wasn't a lot of floor space in the room, but the fridge could still go in the room without being in the way. I thought that very strange. The staff was very nice, and the courtyard is very pretty and has that New Orleans charm. They have a small pool which is great to cool off on a warm, humid day. The hotel doesn't have any individual safes or safety deposit boxes, but you may use the hotel safe. You put your items in a sealed enveloppe and they put it in the safe for you. The hotel also offers a continental breakfast which you can have delivered to your room or eat out in the courtyard (there is no breakfast room). You need to place your order the night before and indicate what time you want your meal. A person doesn't always know what time they'll get up the next morning when they're on vacation (especially in New Orleans), but the breakfast is appreciated. They offer a choice of toast, english muffin or muffin, with tea/coffee and juice. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. With the exception of a couple of times during the week-end, there was no noise issue. There didn't appear to be anybody staying in the room next to me, so I can't comment on room to room noise. Would I stay there again, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindyIllinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and LOVED IT!! It is a charming little hotel in the French Quarters in the perfect location. You park your car and never have to drive until you leave. Sarah was the best hostess!!! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel full of old-world charm in the French Quarter area”
Reviews.Author: procus
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old rustic charming hotel in a fab location right in the heart of the French Quarters . Our room was a bit on the small size and could of been a little bit cleaner but this hotel has all the charm you would expect to find while staying in New Orleans.It's location could not be better... walking distance to Frenchman street, full of great bars bursting with music and also close to Bourbon Street , Jackson Square and the french-markets to shop for some souvenir's. Breakfast in the morning is delivered to your door once you leave your order hanging outside before you go asleep....such a treat to either have breakfast in bed or even better sitting outside on your own balcony watching New Orleans waking up to a new day. We found the staff all to be very friendly and extremely helpful especially Lillian in reception , car-parking is located across the road which was fine ... would stay here again if we ever go back to New Orleans ..really loved our stay in this old unique hotel

Reviews.Title: “One of our Favorites! Loaded with charm!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1990
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel many times in the last 20 years! It's in a great location in the French Quarter and reasonablly priced. Each room is unique, decorated with antiques. It's old but comfy, a little musty in some of the rooms, but not unbareable, ( I always carry room spray anyway) the sheets are clean and the bathrooms are clean. The courtyard is full of charm, we love to sit there by the pool in the evening and have a glass of wine before going to dinner. They deliver the paper to your door and coffee, juices , and muffins if you leave the menu on the door knob before you go to bed. They offer off street parking in a lot across the street. Wendell will take very good care of your car, he's been there for years! He knows just how to pack your bags in the trunk when you leave! The Service is superb! Great Atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rooster-Houdini
Reviews.Content: This writer is a native of the French Quarter, so when I tell you that the hotel is in a great location I know what I am writing about. You really cannot get a better location in the French Quarter that is convenient to all of the major attractions and the Frenchman St. Marigny clubs as well; you can easily walk to every club you want to go to. I was on a trip home to visit family and chose this hotel to stay at for my visit. The room I had was typical for a hotel of that age in the FQ as far as size goes; in other words my room was not spacious, but again, rooms in any other FQ hotel of the same age are not spacious either. If you want a large room stay in one of the tower monstrosities that have sprung up on Canal St. in the past 20 years. But why would you want to stay at one of those, you can stay at one of those in your own home town, so if that is what you prefer stay home. One of the things I like about the hotel is the scale of it. It's only two stories tall, so no elevator, one can move around in the hotel very easily. One flight of stairs and you are on the street, or in the pool, no long walks. I once stayed at the Bellagio in Las Vegas and hated it because it took at least 20 mins to get from my room to the street. A hotel can be too large. The room was clean and had a nice shower, no tub, but I do not use a tub and was glad that I did not have to step into a tub to take a shower. The TV was on the small side, with a minimum of channels, but I wasn't on vacation to watch TV. Breakfast was served every morning along with a copy of the Times-Picayune. I took my breakfast downstairs in the patio, the coffee was very good. The continental breakfast is nothing to rave about, but I have yet to have a continental breakfast in a U.S. hotel that is worth raving about, in that regard the Europeans are way ahead. But really, who cares, if you want breakfast you are in the FQ, just walk down the street, there are plenty of restaurants around. The best quality about the hotel is the staff. If you come to New Orleans remember this, people here will talk to you; its the norm, and if you speak to them you will get to know them and that makes all the difference in the world when staying in a small hotel where you will see the same staff day after day. Remember this too, nothing says hello like money. When you are served breakfast give a tip, when you go out leave a tip for the maid cleaning the room. Tipping is part of the culture in New Orleans; we tip everyone, and everyone expects a tip, and people will respond in kind. In New Orleans it is customary to give someone a little something extra, we even have our own word for it; lagniappe. I was traveling alone on my visit home, I left $2 for the maid, and $2 for breakfast everyday, that's $4 a day, not much at all, but it makes a difference to the staff. It also makes a difference to say "good morning" or respond in kind when someone says it to you. Treat the staff as your peers and with courtesy and you will have a pleasant stay I promise you. Parking: the hotel has offsite valet parking. I never used it because I flew into New Orleans and did not rent a car. No need for a car if one is staying in the FQ. But for those who drive to New Orleans or rent a car all I can tell you is that during my stay at the hotel I never heard anyone complain about waiting for their car to arrive once it was summoned. The bottom line is this, would I stay at this hotel again; yes. There are only four hotels in the FQ that I will stay in, and this is one of the four.

Reviews.Title: “Love it.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel3131963
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose this hotel in the French Quarter for the pics of the rooms. When we arrived, the valet helped unload our car as we had been at a beach for a week first. The car is kept in locked courtyard. I was disappointed at first as we were not staying in the main hotel. We were in a refurbished building across the street. This was not told to me at booking time. However the room was huge with 2 beds, a sofa,an overstuffed chair, tv armoire, huge coffee table to put all your 'stuff''. The bathroom was good sized. We were on the first floor with keys to the building and then inside keys to our room. The room was part of a remodeled bar I found out. It had beautiful dark, wide plank hard wood floors, dark furniture. Coffee, juice, danish and a paper were brought to our room every am. We didn't use the pool...no time...but it looked charming. The staff were friendly and helpful especially the heavy lifting valets. Didn't want to leave. There was street noise but that's New Orleans right. Location is great. Just let the desk know if you will need your car for out of town excursions. Would stay again. Clean except the walls of the bathroom had a lot of scuff marks, a footprint !!?? I wonder how that got there. They need a Mr. Clean eraser. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: tdishrn
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small but very clean. The bathroom was showing some age. Walls were very thin and could hear everything that was going on outside, including them washing the windows at 6am! Slight musty smell, but not bad. The worst thing was the valet parking. They parked my car on Monday and we didn't see it again until Saturday morning when we checked out. There was a huge door ding on the passenger side back door with the paint scratched. I will not stay here again because of that. The only one that could have done it was the Valet. Also, the pool was not cleaned or prepped for swimming until Friday afternoon. We could not see the bottom of the pool when we got there on Monday and it was like that all week until the pool boy showed up on Friday. It was a nice place and worth the money. Within walking distance of everything. Would not be against staying there again, but probably not my first choice because of the valet damaging my car. Internet didn't work either and they didn't know how to fix it. Also, they didn't leave a room service card for us on our last night there. Guess they didn't want to feed us before we left to go back home...

Reviews.Title: “Creepy crawlers”
Reviews.Author: bhays19
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel earlier this week. After I got home I realized i had bites all over me. I went to the doctor, and he told me that I had bed bug bites all over me. I politely called the hotel to make them aware of this so no further guest would get bitten. They replied by telling me I was an idiot and they're not responsible, and i should just keep my mouth shut.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Wate Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Ashley0730
Reviews.Content: The only reason that I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights is because it was already paid for. It was nearly 90-95 degrees in our room and I was told that there was nothing to be done about it because the entire hotel is on one system and it was working as hard as it could to keep everyone cool. Most of the stay it was actually cooler outside than in the room. The vents were blowing air, however it was not cold air. They gave me the lame excuse that they were in the middle of a bizarre heat wave and that is why the air conditioner could not keep up. To bad for them, I am from the area and my husband and I like to visit the French Quarter often. There is no difference in the current heat to that of the years passed. Also, please note all of the previous review entries and their complaints of the heat, along with management's comments that they have so called "fixed" or "addressed" the problem. It is a LIE. The front desk staff was rude, actually telling me at some point to please stop calling the front desk because the temperature could not be fixed. Not once did they offer me a better room, a discount, free parking, a coupon, or anything for that matter. Not even so much as a fan was made available, even after I requested one, I was told that they did not provide fans. When I called the front desk and asked them to call a cab for me for 7:30 p.m. for a dinner reservation, or to provide a contact number so that I could do so myself, I was told that it was to hard to get a cab on Saturday night and that if I still needed one I could walk the 2 blocks to Decatur Street and "attempt to hail one myself." We get much better treatment at the Quality Inn on O'Keefe, for $40 less a night, and a working air conditioner, which is where we usually stay. Upon check out, I was not asked how my stay was, if we enjoyed our trip, etc., NOTHING, I was simply told what amount was due for our room and told that I could walk across the street and ask for my car because the "radio batteries were dead" and the grumpy old man at the desk was not allowed to leave post. After all this, please know that I am 6 1/2 mths pregnant and this was my husband and I's last trip together before baby. Thanks to the Chateau for ruining it, and not even making some attempt to make things right.

Reviews.Title: “European Style Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marielito76
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and found this place a fantastic deal. The pool was a little bit dirty, but that was taken care of. Ask for free valet parking as your discount. The central air condition is surprisingly quiet. Waking distance to the French Market, Bourbon Steet and the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Chateau Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andy90010
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to New Orleans for over 20 years now. While I have stayed at various hotels and guest houses in the city, the Chateau remains my favorite. No, the rooms are not large (nor are the bathtubs!) and the place could do with a good sprucing up. But the location is terrific, the staff extremely congenial, and the courtyard is lovely--especially in the evenings. And the price is most agreeable. Do not go expecting a first class hotel, and always book a room that has a room facing outside. Charming amenities: including free wi-fi and the continental breakfast. All in all, a very charming place to stay--and good on the pocketbook.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the pictures or description”
Reviews.Author: KevintheC
Reviews.Content: I'm easy to please; really. Even "run-of-the-mill" Comfort Inns are fine by me. But I was expecting something a bit more refined in the heart of the French Quarter. Nope. My girlfriend and I were looking forward to our stay at the Chateau from May 22nd to May 26th, in large part due to the photos on the Chateau's website and the flowery description. Ultimately, we were duped. We booked our "king room" several months in advance, only to be tucked into a windowless room near a storage closet and noisy Chartres Street "tunnel." From what we could tell, there were only two rooms out of 45 without windows, and we got one of them. We got a king bed alright, but the bed occupied at least 1/2 the room, with the tiny, stained, dirty bathroom (sporting a 1/2 tub) only three feet from the bed. Other less than desirable "qualities:" the toilet ran infinitely unless you shook the handle; lighting was dim; hotel staff had a difficult time deciphering the difference between 7:00 a.m. and 10:00 a.m. for delivery of the continental breakfast; the "poolside bar" wasn't open ... at all. And lastly, there are rats. Or at least one, who looked right at home running along the base of the non-staffed bar, very near the pool and our room. Oh, did I mention that the Chateau charged $16/night for parking even though their website and the AAA guide book said that there was no charge for parking? Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GoBeavs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in NOLA. This hotel is in a great location just down the street from Lafitte Blacksmith bar. We had 2 rooms and it was a great set-up...1 door entered into our 2 room area with a balcony and view of the pool. I would definately stay here again! The breakfast was a great start and if you didn't put out your slip they'll still get you something. The help was friendly and the building old NOLA charm. This is not the Hilton, this is something for those that like the local feel. I believe if you have AAA parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY, BAD SERVICE -- AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: marylouretton
Reviews.Content: we gave the hotel every opportunity possible to make things right, but since we pre-paid for a room during jazzfest, we got the shaft. the hotel boasts 45 rooms that overlook the courtyard or the quarter, which is a LIE. we were put in a dungeon-like room with no windows next to the cleaning quarters. the sliding lock inside the door was broken. we ignored these two things, and it got progressively WORSE. the maids woke us up every morning with yammering and clatter in the hallway. you could peek through the door blinds to see inside the room the eucalyptus above the tv was covered in months of dust the vents had dust there was to temperature control, just on or off for the air the wall paper was peeling the cable tv had static reception the hallway was cluttered with trash and extra crap left out by the hotel there is no video camera in the main gateway, through which strangers came in on a regular basis to admire the courtyard and to top it all off, we got a visits from a HUGE cockroach in the shower (no tub) the final night, and my girlfriend found a little roach near her muffin in our room the next morning. all this for five nights for only $1000? what a bargain! WORST HOTEL STAY EVER. and we have stayed at hotels of all types the world over.

Reviews.Title: “Used To Be Better - Sort of Sucky Now”
Reviews.Author: IsAirren
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on and off over the last 20 years. It used to be an average/cheap place with a great location, a little quirky, but it seems times have changed, and not for the better at Chateau. The last time we stayed here (April 2011) there were too many things that disappointed us. Some of these things could be overlooked, but all together made for a not great experience. 1) They advertised free Wifi - but sadly, the wifi was unusable, had to go to local coffee shop to do business. 2) Parking is expensive and right across the street - which would be fine if the desk guy would radio for your car for you. He said he would, but 20 min later, no car came. We walked across the street and told the valet guys which car was ours and they drove it 12 feet to us - they said the desk guy doesn't know how to use the radio and that happens all the time. 3) They assigned us the loudest, smallest room (115 right across from the office) - this could happen to anyone, someone has to stay there I guess. 4) Room dirty, wallpaper peeling, broken mirror, towels not exactly white. 5) We left 4 items of clothing in the closet and remembered when we got home (the same day). We called and they said they found the clothes and told us to send them a check for $12 so they could mail the clothes to us. We did right away. 3 weeks later we received a beat up box of clothes that were not ours. I called and explained to the desk guy who told me to call the next day, i did, then he told me to call on Thursday, which i did. He then told me that they didn't have our clothes. (???) What the heck is going on at this place? They didn't offer to refund the shipping $ we sent to get our stuff back either. 6) If you're still reading, this is the worst of all. This hotel still uses metal keys, which is fine, except: My husband went back to our room to grab a beverage, he opened the door... only to realize that he was in the wrong room. Mistakenly he entered the room next to ours, using our key. So are all the keys the same? Huge security problem for me. Pros: Courtyard very pretty, unheated pool nice, great location, breakfast is nice (IF you get the hang tag for your door, which we only got half of the time). The woman who brings the breakfast is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable small hotel with many extras for the price”
Reviews.Author: CatinRzeszow
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nights here at Easter with my 76 yr old mother in room 227 (very large double room with wonderful external balcony - our request to people watch) while the carpets may be a bit worn, the room had charm and was well stocked with towels and toiletries. extras like a daily continental breakfast, newspaper, a refridgerator (none of which the Ramada Bourbon gave for a higher price) were appreciated. not a chain hotel - felt cozy. the pool, tho small is lovely. perhaps the bar opens up later in the season. you can walk everywhere from here - several times a day. would definitely stay here again having seen the competition. was very comfortable. only drawback no wifi.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ohmygod60750
Reviews.Content: Well I am not sure where I need to start. I was very excited when I booked this place because it seemed like a great location and cute and cozy. NONE OF THE ABOVE! I rented the suite up at the top. It's the one when you go all the way up the stairs to the left. Don't get me wrong I understand these places are old but this was way too much.. When we got up to our room there was cobwebs all over. The smell inside smelled like burnt flesh if that is even a smell. I had to call them 3 times to come and see about the smell because it was THAT bad. They had to put "air" cleaners in the room. They had 3 hooked up. They said we could keep them the entire weekend if we wanted, because that is a relaxing vacation. The air didn't work, it was HOT AND STICKY. The bathroom was DISGUSTING. There was hair all over the counter and the towels were stained and nasty. Let me go to the bed. It STUNK so bad that I refused to lay in it. I was actually scared that the sheets were not even clean. LONG story short, I was planning on staying here for 3 days and after 5 hours there I checked out and went to the HILTON, where I had a clean room and NICE people. BTW, did I mention that when I explained to the lady that I wanted to check out because of all these reasons she REFUSED and said I was LYING. I still had to pay 300 dollars because she said now they wont have a chance of getting anyone in the room and I caused them to LOOSE money. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS IT”
Reviews.Author: dmorales1
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cozy place to relax. At Chateau you get a more one on one then you do at the big hotels. Donna who brings you breakfast in the morning is the SWEETEST person we have ever met traveling. We had a great stay and we are already talking about going back in May.

Reviews.Title: “I found it by chance and I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hello2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the city; it's very well taken care for, the rooms are small but tidy and clean, breakfast was simple but lovely, surrounded by flowers, birds and happy people (in particular the very welcoming cook) I suggest it for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tommijo
Reviews.Content: I just got home from my weekend stay. I loved this hotel! Our room door was safely tucked away inside the hotel yet we had windows to the street so we could still see hear and smell the wonders of new Orleans. Great location we could walk anywhere we wanted easily. Can't wait to stay again and see what the other room have to offer!!! Room 104 gets 5 stars for sure.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE.”
Reviews.Author: InaBox77
Reviews.Content: As a person who travels to NOLA at least twice a year for 10 years, I've seen quite a few hotels. This is the WORST one I've been in. I understand hotels in the quarter can be outdated, old, in need of repair... I get it. Im used to it. Sometimes it is what adds charm to places. This place is not one of them. We booked a "double" room, the room was ultra small. There was only one key when we checked in, which made me wonder who had the other one and if the lock had been changed since it was lost... Front desk was very non chalant about it and did not really think it was a big deal and was rude. The sink backed up, there is no shelf in the bathroom to put anything. Carpeting old and smelled. The heat was on in the entire hotel. It was close to 80 degees in our room. We slept with the door open and the shower running with cold water, as did our neighbors. which I am sure made the rats we saw very happy. We were told there were no fans available and there was no way the heat would be shut off. There were no windows to open. Front desk did not really care or ask how our stay was when we checked out. Im sure they had many complaints. Pay the extra money and go somewhere else. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ripoff ever. Stay away from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller900
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is run by a couple of scam artists. Charged 4 times the normal rate during Mardigras week, and then had the audacity to charge another $25.00 for their garage parking (They dont have a garage, just a vacant area across from the hotel..Was told when I booked that parking was free, and then saw online that it was 15.00 per day, but then charged when I arrived at $25.00 per day due to a "special event"..Complaints did no good, the old man at the desk basically said pay it or dont park. breakfast was poor, cold, toast and coffee only...Stale bread is quite a treat 1st thing in the am!. The room was dirty, floors never vacummed during our stay, and had to ask for clean linens when we arrived as the bed still had used sheets on it--extreemely gross....Customer service is not here for sure..Take our advice and stay away from this one..Better rooms are avail up on Royal and canal streets..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Golden_Mustang
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel right in the middle of the french quarter two blocks away from the cathedral, if you are lucky you can get one of the inside rooms, last time we went there we got a room outside next to the hotel and our door was in front of the street, so, you can hear whatever noise the street may have and if you are a light sleeper its not going to be a nice experience. The service is ok, they have their own parking lot ($15 fee) and some kind of valet so you don't have to worry about your ride. It has a nice little pool just in case the heat is too aggressive.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel/Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: katt-n-rey
Reviews.Content: We stayed Valentine's weekend; a surprise wedding anniversary present for my hubby. When doing my research I wanted old world charm, no bed bugs, great location & service, a late check out time (1 p.m.), great showers, free wifi and reasonably priced parking. The hotel met all of our expectations and more; the staff was very knowledgable and polite. The beds were super comfy and our suite was very charming and romantic. The previous blogger/poster is very much correct, t/ gal (Donna I think) who brought us breakfast was always super nice!!!!! On a different note, if you tend to sweat the small stuff, you may perceive the out-of-sight dust bunnies, wall cracks, and weathered paint as unacceptable, whereas we perceived them character flaws. However, t/ hotel is undergoing rennovations. The architecual design of the hotel and our suite was absolutely beautiful. We would definitely stay there again!!!!! We enjoyed our stay there more so than our five star hotel in Cabo San Lucus (honeymoon) .

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay to be in French Quarters in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: skanoerse
Reviews.Content: A very good place to stay if you want to be in the middle of the french quarter in New Orleans. The price is reasonable if you consider that the parking is included. nice rooms, good beds, nice helpful staff, specialy the lady in charge of the breakfast, wich is served in your room. The only downturn is the internet connection, in our room it was very bad, this made us leave a day or two earlier than we would have stayed, if it had been working. It was not possible to use Skype and the connection was lost very freqvently. If you need to use the net to be connected - chose another hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location amidst the lovely french quarter”
Reviews.Author: iamthehighway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week in March and enjoyed our stay. We were initially put in a room which opened onto the street and looked from the outside like a stable entrance; the inside was small but well-decorated. We asked to be shifted to an inside courtyard, which became available after 2 nights. The courtyard room was very comfortable; noise is not an issue where this hotel is located. The rooms are immaculate, except a glaring exception which was the bathroom in the first room that had a stained bathtub and sink. The courtyard itself is charming, although chilly when we went (early March), with a small lounging pool and a bar through which breakfast is served. I'm fairly certain people make good use of the pool and lounging chairs in the summer Breakfast was continental, and picked up from the bar/kitchen area to eat there or to take to our room (we tried both at various times). The concierge was helpful in recommending places to eat, and of course the location is so great that you'll pretty much stumble upon somewhere delightful within 2 walking blocks. The water is like 3 blocks away, the market is 2 blocks away. Basically everything is very close, and the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved my stay at the Chateau Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny8675309_84
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel room online for my husbands birthday. When we arrived in New Orleans we promptly got lost. My husband called the desk and he gave us step by step instructions on how to find the hotel. He was very helpful. When we arrived at the hotel we were met by the smiling faces and excellent service. The rooms were gorgeous and you felt like you were stepping back in time with the atmosphere of the place. The courtyard is stunning. The staff is wonderful. The breakfast was brought to our room and it was delightful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants truly experience the beauty of the French-Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans charm in the heart of the Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: StacyChampaign
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the middle of everything in the French Quarter. Perfect if you're looking for an authentic French Quarter place to stay. Miss Donna made it a place to remember.

Reviews.Title: “BEST”
Reviews.Author: NEIL078
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the chateau hotel for one week dec.19 th to 24th. we had a room with a balcony facing chartres street,it was just wonderful.location of the chateau is right in the middle of the french quarter. so close to jackson square, restaurants, streetcars and attractions and of course the famous cafe do monde.it was very quiet although so close to everything,we loved to hear the clicking of the horses going by. chateau offers a continental breakfast,free parking with a aaa card ,internet ,10 percent discount for seniors and free newspaper a beautiful courtyard and pool. great employees. the breakfast if taken to your room every morning by donna ,she jus a wonderful person and employyee. she calls you before comming and makes sure you are completely safisfied. we cant't say enough about this caring person. thank you so much donna for making our vacation better. our grandchildren victoria and nick love you.i recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, over priced, rude people in the office”
Reviews.Author: stephiemc
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location and the charm of this hotel. That being said, the people in the office were not friendly, in fact they were just rude. The internet said the price was $79 per night. But when I called they said it was $185. Big difference, but I had called 7 other hotels and no vacancy. So we agreed to the $185. One the first night, the ppl next door said they had paid $79. The people the next night paid $109 plus 16 parking. The third night, $169 plus parking. We asked why we were being charged $185, they laughed and said everyone else had lied! Anyway, when we check out, they tried to charge us $16 per day for parking. I lost it. We did not pay it.
