On another note, the rooms are NOT clean. Our room was upstairs, so the noise was not bad, but our friends was street level and they had alot of trouble sleeping. But it was the French Quarter, so that's expected really. The rest of the staff was great, just not the office people. We might return if we could settle on a reasonable price and couldn't find another hotel with vacancy that might be a little cleaner. It was really dirty. I don't the floors had been swept in weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn32Alli
Reviews.Content: Pluses: The outside of the hotel is very charming. It's in a great location near all of the activity on Bourbon Street as well as Frenchman St. where we found tons of great bars with live music. The complementary breakfast was nice (it's just bread items, but the banana nut muffins were delicious and the coffee good), and I also really enjoyed meeting and talking to Donna who serves breakfast either to you in your room or in the courtyard. The courtyard was lovely. Minuses: The room left A LOT to be desired. Dark, grungy looking carpet that I didn't want to put my bare feet on. A bathroom that was depressing. The walls and ceilings were stained. It's not the kind of room that puts you in a happy or romantic mood, in fact, it put me in a bad mood. A saving grace was that the bed was comfortable and I did sleep soundly (although the first night I could hear a man in the next room snoring). The walls were thin and had the hotel been crowded, I'm sure I would be complaining about the noise. I was tempted to change hotels (or at least rooms), but I thought that I was paying a rate of $89/night for the weekend and $79/night for the week, so I figured for that inexpensive rate, I'd just stay put. WELL, when it came time to pay the bill, I was charged $129/weekend night and $89/week night. Had I known I was paying $129/night, I would have definitely switched rooms at the least. Make sure to get an email confirmation when you make the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hippiegypsy207
Reviews.Content: i always stay here.....always. the staff is always friendly and remember who i am. it's in a perfect location that feels like my own little neighborhood. i like bringing new people down to experience all that is new orleans and the charming place i stay. this last visit was wonderful. i had reservered two of my favorite rooms for myself and a first-timer to the city. when we arrived we were informed that we were moved to a different room. we were walked across the street to a building i've walked by several times, but had no idea how beautiful it was inside. a huge king-sized bed in the room right off a large balcony with a cozy loft above the kitchen and living area. it was toasty and warm and reminded me of a place i've stayed in colorado. it was great to have the vibe of my two favorite places at one time.

Reviews.Title: “This place is pretty run down”
Reviews.Author: cjack56
Reviews.Content: The first room they gave us was a king on the second floor with a balcony. Sound nice? Anything but. Street noise was unbearable. The carpet and walls were filthy, not just a little dirty. Absolutely filthy. The second room they was facing the courtyard and was much better. Very dark and cave-like. Carpet was still a mess, but all in all was in much better condition that the first. The location is great, must be why so many people stay here. If you don't plan to spend much time in the room, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great exterior & location- but the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: howwasyourtrip_10
Reviews.Content: The staff are wonderful, really helpful and want to please, but the rooms need a lot of work. It looks like these rooms haven't had any attention for decades and there's so much potential. The "old style" shower/tub is old plastic, now tinted yellow-brown and the edging moldy, (the first room we had I refused to use the shower and the carpet was so dirty I wouldn't walk around in bare feet- they moved us). Everything feels unclean because everything is so old and I don't mean in a charming way as you might expect in New Orleans. The carpets are crusty and feel dirty- they need to go. The towels supplied were so old they were no longer all white and had threads hanging off them and the bed linens were pilling. Breakfast is served in your room at no extra cost, which is lovely, but the trays used to serve the food looked like they've been brought in from McDonalds, and they still have sticky kids fingerprints on them. Even though I know the staff worked really hard to make our stay pleasant, I felt like the tools they'e working with made this difficult. I would definitely go back if they refurbish.

Reviews.Title: “Just too funky...”
Reviews.Author: G_Cheblo
Reviews.Content: We *really* wanted to make this work, as we loved the charming courtyard and excellent location. When we arrived, we held our misgivings about the damp, moldy smell in the room. There were no windows to open, so the only option was to leave the door chained and slightly ajar to clear the smell â€“ not an optimal solution from a safety standpoint. Unfortunately, we saw a rat running through the courtyard, so the door stayed closed after that. When I looked to find an outlet for my phone charger, I discovered a used condom behind the concave sinkhole of a bed. The bathroom was a potential death trap, with an open-pit style shower two steps down from an elevated toilet ringed with mildew â€“ rustic to say the least. All these concerns were tolerable, because the staff was mostly friendly and helpful, the location was excellent, and frankly, weâ€™ve stayed at funkier locales in our youth. We finally left after two would-be Jerry Springer extras moved into the room below us and commenced cavorting with a blaring TV, an appalling stream of profanity, and loud verbiage reminiscent of scenes from Deliverance. Not the quiet room we hoped and paid for. We finally surrendered. Equivalent or improved accommodation could not be provided in the facility (and that is saying a lot). At 10 pm, we abruptly relocated to a higher-rated (yet surprising less expensive) accommodation down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the location, not the room”
Reviews.Author: MinervaZee
Reviews.Content: I found the Chateau Hotel to be a mixed bag. My husband loved it; I thought it was overpriced. It was motel quality at hotel prices (what you're really paying for is the location). Despite that, I'd stay there again, just in a different room. If you get a deal on this hotel, definitely go for it. Pros: * Great Location (in the french quarter, but on the charming, rather than rowdy, end) * Friendly, helpful staff * Clean * Bed was REALLY comfortable. * Beautiful high ceilings * Lovely courtyard with a small pool * Eating the free continental breakfast in the courtyard was a wonderful way to start the day. (they'll deliver it to your room free too, so you can have breakfast in bed!) * very effective AC * Mini-fridge in the room Cons: * Peeling wallpaper; dumpy-looking room. * Something about the room (mold? perfume?) made me sneeze like crazy after sleeping there. Cleared up after being outside for a while; came back the next morning. (This may be the nature of new orleans hotels, given the climate). * Our room (111) had no windows, and was close to the street. Street noise woke us often. * The free wi-fi didn't reach to our room.

Reviews.Title: “What a COOL place to be!”
Reviews.Author: billingstwosome
Reviews.Content: Well, I was a little apprehensive after reading the "bedbugs" review, but that was not a problem. I looked around, didn't find any. Had a terrific time there. Beautiful historic hotel in a great location for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Vdragonchic
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in the suite. You cannot beat the location or the value of this hote. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and accomidating, and the rate was fabulous. Here's a couple things to know about the suite. It's a 2 bedroom / 2 bath suite with a living room and kitchen. There's a balcony overlooking the street off one of the bedrooms. This makes this bedroom a little loud, but it's a relatively quiet street and for a long weekend no real bother. The other bedroom was up in the loft, so not completely private but much quieter. For 4 nights we stayed for approximately $100 per person a night. Given all the space we had, we couldn't have asked for a better deal. Our breakfast was brought to us each morning, thus allowing us to enjoy it out on our balcony. The suite is a in a separate building than the main hotel, so we didn't really take advantage of the court yard or pool. The beds were amazingly comfortable. The hotel is a couple block walk to Bourbon & Royal streets one way and Decatur & French Market the other way. I highly recommend eating at Irene's (reservations required - closed Sun/Mon) which is literally a couple buildings away from the hotel. Finegan's Pub across the street is a perfect 'stop in for a last drink before we go up to bed' place (yes, it's open 24 hours, no that is NOT a problem). Book your time in New Orleans at the Chateau Hotel - you won't regret it! I will try to come back and post my photos.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: fun4roge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chateau Hotel on a trip to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We had no reservations and called the hotel on the way down. The person who answered the phone was extremely nice and helpful in giving directions. When we arrived, check-in was super fast as and we were in our room in a matter of minutes. The room decor was older but exactly what we expected. Very clean and the bed was so comfortable! The courtyard was absolutely lovely and the atmosphere was so "New Orleans"! We loved it. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was super nice (especially "Donna" who probably deserves a raise!). It was located close to everything we wanted to see! We will definitely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for nothing”
Reviews.Author: Drdigg
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and hated it. Bell man was great and courtyard is beautiful. We were even fine with the room size due to its historic nature. But, we weren't expecting holes in the bathroom wall, peeling wallpaper, a bed that smelled like a mixture of BO and mildew, and a carpet too disgusting to walk bare foot on. Add hearing the people next door like they are in the room and you have a recipe for an unhappy customer. We were booked for three nights for our wedding anniversary and asked if we could cancel in the morning (we would pay for one night) and were told to wait for the manager in the morning and that "it's a historic hotel" in response to our complaints. Duh! That's why we wanted to stay here, because it IS a historic hotel. And how about a real solution to our problems or I'm sorry it's not for you, sir. But we didn't think it would be this bad. I blame false advertising on this and hope we can leave without paying for another night.Â

Reviews.Title: “Not just a Hotel an experience”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix52
Reviews.Content: Traveling with friends and picked this hotel for the New Orleans experience. If you don't want a cookie cutter hotel this is for you. It takes you back to old New Orleans. The room is decorated in the New Orleans theme. The beds are small doubles. It seems strange at first but gets you in the mood to experience New Orleans as it should be. The room was on the second floor that opened onto a small balcony. A patio is below. It was shrouded in fog when we were there. We never went outside that our glasses didn't fog up. The doors lock with a key. This hotel is about 150 years old. It was abandoned in the 50's and remodeled in 1959. The staff was friendly and the french market and bourbon street were close. We were there when the Saints won their first game of the season and we expected a lot of party noise. We heard a little, but not much. The room is very small, especially for four women with a lot of luggage. Continental Breakfast is limited to muffins, coffee and juice, served by a waitress on the patio. There is a parking fee. A parking lot down the street. This hotel is an experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE & GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye10k
Reviews.Content: great warm and friendly staff. my room was very clean. and for a total amount of $192.00 dollars for 3 nights .... well , need i say more ?

Reviews.Title: “This is definitely a Keeper”
Reviews.Author: CowgirlBeachBum
Reviews.Content: Liked the room; tastfully done, cool AC felt secure as room opened on to a private courtyard; nice little pool; very nice & helpful staff. Location was perfect, close to Jackson Square and shopping and eateries but far enough away to be fairly quiet. Very clean and bed and pillows were quite good. We will go back to N.O. and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not spectacular but generally pleased”
Reviews.Author: bamatraveler_9
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was pleased with the hotel. Our first night we stayed in a windowless interior room that smelled like mildew and was a bit drab. However, the second night we changed to a room with a balcony and were much happier. The staff was quite nice about moving us to a better room (was actually there idea so they must know 228 is not so pleasant). The comment on their website about the beautiful outside bar is misleading. We brought our own drinks and sat there one night but we were the only ones there and I wouldn't say it's a bar. The service was good though, especially the lady in the morning who serves breakfast and coffee. The staff was friendly and the service prompt. It's an older hotel and the years certainly show but still a nice hotel and pleasant place to stay. And the location is absolutely amazing-just two blocks from Jackson Square. I'd stay again but only if I had a balcony room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find.”
Reviews.Author: kirbybunny
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chateau Hotel and it will not be our last. It has all the wonderful New Orleans charm and the location is awsome. It's 2 blocks from Jackson Square, Bourbon St., the French Market, the Street Car and great places to eat. The hotel is an older building ( this is real New Orleans ), the rooms are just all U need for your visit beacuse if U plan to spend all your time in the room why did you come to New Orleans. The court yard is great for your morning free contintial breakfast which is just enough to get U going for the day and also can be delivered to your room. The staff was all great and helpful ( Danny was awsome ). Yes the parking cost but very few hotels in the French Quarter have free parking again this is New Orleans. We enjoyed being able to walk back to our hotel & take a nap or drop shopping bags off with out feeling we had to go out of our way to do so.. It's just a great location. Have already recommeded to several friends. Wonderful trip. Thank U very much Danny. The Kirbys

Reviews.Title: “The was no AC control in room, just a switch”
Reviews.Author: blf12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and we got a coupon at the visitors center that gave us free parking. Unfortunately, we did not sleep this night because we were hot in the room. The AC for the hotel controlled all the rooms. There was a light switch on the wall that did not help at all. If you are hot natured, don't stay there. Also, our remote control for the TV was not working. We requested someone to come fix it and nobody came. Also, we tried to sleep until check out but the maids were extremely noisy. So, we got up and checked out.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: pdenzel274
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old but has all the New Orleans charm and character we were looking for. The location is great- 2 short blocks to Jackson Square & just 1 to French Market and River. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant. This was our first trip to New Orleans and we were a little apprehensive after reading some not so great reviews, but I'm returning for a long weekend with friends and we certainly will be staying at the Chateau.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: bootssys
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect hotel! It was at a great location, 2 blocks from Burboun St and 2 blocks from the French Market. The staff was fabulous and everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not really worth the$$$$”
Reviews.Author: kimball9
Reviews.Content: paid 60.00 more for Fat Tues arrival. Parking is valet and a good deal- staff was friendly Room very very antiquated with 1 window directly on the street room dim bathtub more like a shower stall- lighting in BR flickered all the time. Kitchen where you get breakfast ( coffee toast, muffin, danish) off patio and yes a big rat trap right there. Location excellent but I don't think I would go back there again. As for mardi gras just too crazy wall to wall crazies long long long lines at cafe du monde

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money!”
Reviews.Author: whitea123
Reviews.Content: I arrived here today on the 21st, soon as you get on the block of the hotel, parking is impossible, so we had to pay for private parking which is $16 dollars a day with no choice. As soon as. we walked in the lobby its small. We checked in and the bell man was friendly and professional. He helped us upstairs to our room. When we walked in to the box they called a room, I already knew we was not going to spend another night here. First, the room is small the tv had so much static in it, the mini fridge is in the closet. The shower is so small, it can fit a two year old in there. I didnt bother to unpack, the door to the room is not safe, anyone can come in your room without a problem, just a credit card can open up the door. I hate here. You spend to much for a hole in the wall place, but it had a great location to the area,. Thats the only thing I can say, I will never come back here again !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Update from my previous eview”
Reviews.Author: hrcmkl
Reviews.Content: The Chateau really is our choice after 15 yearly visits to N O. From the staff - retention is at probably 90% - to the most perfect location, there is little to compain about. Sure it's very dated, small rooms that need attention, limited amenities, but to us it's the essence of New Orleans. Hope for a retunr trip in March!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and faded decadance in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: BarryJohn4
Reviews.Content: We had our booking made for us at one of the many Visitor's centres, not realising that this was the weekend of THE huge football match and the whole New Orleans area was going wild! When I sopke from the centre to the fron t desk, I realised that the Old Southern Hospitality attitude was sadly lacking in Robert, the chap with whom I spoke. This was verified upon meeting him - the TV programme he never took his eyes away from , was obviously of more importance to him than our booking. Because of the lack of accommodation in the hotel, we were warned that our room was windowless - and less said about it the better although I will say that it was contained in an annex room that opened directly onto the street. as we, and one poor dear lady, found to her cost! The weather was qppalling and the only area for breakfast was outside in the inner courtyard which would be charming in the sunlight but quite disasterous in the middle of a rainstorm. The breakfast woman was less than helpful, considering we had no idea what we were supposed to do in these circumstances and her attitude was aggessive and offensive. In spite of breakfast being included, we only ate there once more when we were assured she wasn't on duty! Confrontation is the last thing you need on your yearly holiday. It was with some relief, therefore, that the front desk rota changed, and we met Lillian - a pure joy of a lady, who smoothed things out for us, transferred us to a far better room with balcony, as soon as it was available and proffered local advice on where to go and what to eat. We found the cleaning staff to be happy and chatty but they are not the Public face of the Chateau hotel, after all. All in all , the Chateau suffers from lack of obvious management structure, a lack of management interest and a sense of hostile hospitality, apart from the exception of the dear lady in Reception.. The owner needs to shake the whole place up, spend money on repairing curtains that don't close properly, unstick windows that are painted up and won't open, damp that affects the bathrooms and certainly advise the staff that smoking in public areas is just not on.with the type of guests who would pay the kind of money the Chateau demands.

Reviews.Title: “just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: annG81
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the chateau hotel for new years with friends. i was a little worried after some reviews that i read that were pretty bad but i was very pleasantly suprised when we arrived. the pictures i have seen are pretty much exactly what you will see when you get there and the staff was for the most part very friendly and helpful. i would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the french quarter and that doesn't need "high-end luxury" to be happy. the chateau was clean and very quaint. i loved the courtyard and style of building however if i had any complaints it would be that the walls seem to be pretty thin...so if noise is an issue for you, you might not be happy here. also the bedding and just basic decor of the room was a little dull and out of date but it was clean and thats all that really matters. also if you do have a car they have on site parking which is big in new orleans...i would double check with the hotel directly about price because it was different that what the website said due to a special event.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, old world flavor”
Reviews.Author: MargotW
Reviews.Content: My husband and goddaughter and I stayed at the Chateau Hotel right after Christmas having booked a room sight unseen from a listing of French Quater hotels. I was a little apprehensive but was pleasently surprised. The office staff were very helpful, the room was quite comfortable (we weren't in it long enough at any point for anything to bother us), and it was just 2 blocks from Jackson Square. We had a room with a balcony which gave us a unique view out into the Quarter (my goddaughter and I are both photo buffs so needless to say we were pleased to get really good photos from that vantige point). We had wireless internet access so that both my husband and I could check office emails (when/if we wanted to). A little refrigerator in the room was all we needed to keep the occasional drink or snack cool. The best part was falling asleep to the sound of the horse drawn carriages coming by the hotel - it was like being transported back into another age. Not for everyone - if you're looking for a room with a modern look and feel you probably won't be happy there. But We were very comfortable and would book a room there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Awesome, Office Staff Not so good!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bethndr
Reviews.Content: We came in October and Stayed with a group of girls, when we first arrived the office staff was very rude and not helpful at all. We had 9 girls staying with us as we had the large suite and extra room. they told me at the time i booked the rooms that i was allowed 3 parking spots and said NOTHING about paying $16 per car per day. and when we got there we were only allowed two parking spots. Then on Saturday we did not want room service, when we went out. But wanted towels later that afternoon around 5:30pm and they told us if we wanted towels we should have gotten room service. they never brought us towels and we had to go get them. We had an awesome time in New Orleans and i would love to stay there again because we liked the rooms so much but the office staff needs to learn what customer service is and when you are in a hospitality industry ecspecially in our economy today there are any more hotels people could stay at and they should be grateful and accomodating to their guests!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: 5voyageurs
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean but might have needed a fresh coat of paint. It was quiet but near the effervescence of Bourbon street. Free breakfest in the morning by the pool. The pool is great and our family was always the only one in it! Free parking wich is a plus. Very friendly welcom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price.......”
Reviews.Author: SouthKelly
Reviews.Content: This was a great location in the French Quarters. We were in walking distance to everything. We got lost on the way to the hotel but the receptionist guided us directly to the hotel. The room was small but the price was worth staying in a smaller room. The bathrooms were very small. If you're not looking for the finest of hotels this one will do.

Reviews.Title: “It's a shame. I had such high hopes...”
Reviews.Author: simpletruth1365
Reviews.Content: This place has the potential to be something exceptional. The location is fantastic and the courtyard is absolutely lovely. But, as the other reviewer said- staff is surly, depressed, resentful. Breakfast lady was a terror- infuriating my husband, and causing a lady with two small children to cry. C'mon people! There are so many hotels in the quarter. Don't you want to keep your customers? Room interiors are downtrodden with peeling wallpaper, sad bathrooms with touchy plumbing. Air-conditioner has two settings- on or off (freezing or oppresive are the two choices). I've stayed in many places in the quarter, Garden district. Spend a couple dollars extra and stay at the Hotel Provincial just a few doors down on Chartres.

Reviews.Title: “OK... for the price”
Reviews.Author: Any1
Reviews.Content: Moved from the Hilton to the Chateau, which probably magnified the difference. It was small, clean-ish (could do with freshening up) and basic. But there was also a big difference in price, which was why I moved from the Hilton. I would stay again if my goal was finding a cheap basic place to sleep, but I would probably pay slightly more for something a bit better. However the location was good, the staff were pleasant and I was on my own, but felt safe and I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from "lovely rooms away from the main building"”
Reviews.Author: MattModine
Reviews.Content: We arrived to New Orleans after a long flight after making a phone reservation directly with the hotel sales manager who told us that the rooms are available from 11 am. Since we arrived at 9am we left our luggage at the desk and went for a stroll round the city. We returned at 11:30 only to be told that only one room is ready. "Lovely rooms away from the main building" are situated in a small shack (if you're lucky you'll get a window) and with paper thin walls (we had very quiet neighbours, yet we heard everything they did). After waiting for several hours we finally got our second room round 2:30 pm with no apology from the concierge. The best experience came later that night. We went to sleep roun midnight only to be awaken by the phone call round 2:30am. there was nobody on the phone so we thought it was a prank. however, a minute later there was a bang on the door - bell boy was waiting on the street in front of our room. We couldn't beleive that the hotel would wake us up at 2:30 in the morning. I call the reception and again without an apology I was explained that the thermometer for all 4 "lovely room" was convenietly located above my bed and that it needed fine tuning at this hour. Cherry on the cake was what came out of bell boy's mouth after he heard we were unlocking the door to let him in: Hurry up man, it's raining!. Next day we were angry at the concierge - again no apologies. However after screaming at him we got different room for the second night. Since we took a tourist trip to the swamps, we came late that day (5pm) and were accused by the concierge that we were getting back to him for what they did to us the first day - we had to take our stuff to the other room and they were expecting us to do so at 11 am (!) so that they could rent our "lovely" rooms to some other poor plonker. That was not all, We booked the rooms under my card but as we were checking out we used my friend's card because we were told that they hadn't actually charged my card. You can imagin that when I came back home and checked my account, my credit card was charged. Phoning them back I was told that the manager had to leave the city for an emergency and that she is the only one who deals with the money. I was refunded only one week later. All in all, try to avoid this "institution". If you have to stay however ask for the rooms in the main building and pay with cash!

Reviews.Title: “The old place needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: kleebeck
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay during the French Quarter Festival (room 103). Let me begin by saying that we have been very loyal to the Chateau for our 15 years of traveling there and have recommended the Chateau to many friends & family. We were very disappointed at how the place has deteriorated. The carpet was filthy, the tiles were almost falling off the bathroom ceiling, there wasn't enough hot water, the TV had constant stripes running over it and the room smelled so moldy that we had to keep the AC on constantly to make the smell go away. The beautiful courtyard of the past is no longer. The pool was dirty and the fountain was green. I really hope the owners replace the carpeting with hard wood and do some major renovating with out taking away the charm of the old place. On the upside we love the location, but won't return until we know the Chateau has been upgraded. We love Idessa, Wendell and the bell boys.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter charm”
Reviews.Author: Gomerel
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights while attending PyrateCon. The room was clean. There was no smell or smoke or anything else. The hotel is well located for enjoying the French Quarter. This is an old building. The bathroom is not spacious. If you are looking for shiny and modern, go to a chain hotel. If you are looking for a classic NOLA hotel, this is a good bet. There is a small pool, which I did not use. It looked fine for relaxing, maybe not for doing laps. Did not have a car, so can't comment on parking. Like most of the French Quarter, the hotel might not be good for disabled people. My room was up either narrow inside stairs or up outside wooden stairs. There may be accessible rooms. Don't know. Staff was polite and helpful. I absolutely would stay there again. At this point, it would be my first choice. (I have been to NOLA 4 times now. Twice, I stayed at major chain hotels, which were ok. Once, I stayed at another small hotel, which was charming but smelled of smoke and mildew.)

Reviews.Title: “The only positive is the location”
Reviews.Author: log24
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends for Mardi Gras weekend '09 at the Chateau Hotel. The hotel was conveniently located in the French Quarter. That's where the positives end. One of our rooms had no windows and no air circulation. Only heat was available, kind of like a college dorm room in the winter months. If you prefer the consistency and quality of a chain like the Marriott or the Hilton, the Chateau is not for you. The rooms seem like they were last updated in 1989. There are no elevators, likely due to the age of the property. The bathroom had a screwdriver and a bunch of screws on the floor. The smell upon entering the room was moldy. The sheets felt old and worn, like something you'd experience when visiting your grandparents. Stay at a chain and avoid this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Friend4Life
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel in america! My wife and I have done a lot of traveling around the world and when we stayed at the Chateau for a wedding weekend it was comparable to the worst hostel situation you can imagine. An unfriendly and uncooperative desk staff lent itself to several confrontations after first being put into a smokers room, with a leaking ceiling with five foot water puddle on the floor, and sinks that didn't drain. The second room had stained sheets and a window that would not close. Finaly in our third room we found peace for the night. On the second night some friends came to town and discovered a mouse in the bathroom. When we reported it to the front desk, they acted as if it was not a big deal and didn't offer to move our room. I called to discuss some sort of dicount on the stay and was given nothing for our incovenience. In addition, the cost was perplexing, at $169/night this place deserves no ones business.

Reviews.Title: “Charming.”
Reviews.Author: spisovatelka
Reviews.Content: In a word, this was quite the picturesque place when I last stayed. Located in an area that is close to most things, the staff was always kind and considerate. My only complaint was the generic breakfast. It has a quaintness and nostalgia that I will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “wonder location, economical, parking ok, smoking allowed”
Reviews.Author: Zingingablenessedly
Reviews.Content: i checked many reviews of french quarter hotels. my man smokes, and some hotels don't allow smoking anywhere on premises, even on the balconies. this place allows smoking, but the room smelled fresh and clean. we got the honeymoon suite - the most expensive room there, for $170 plus tax. parking was only $16 compared to $30 for most other hotels in fq. so we got the most expensive suite for less than a cheap room at other hotels. difficult to locate the parking area, which is on st. philip avenue in middle of block. staff helped us maneuver our big pick-up into the tiny parking spot. i tripped over the hump where the gates lock, and my knee and hand are really sore. staff said many people trip over it. they painted it black by the next morning. check-in quick even with three people ahead of us; escorted to room 239. wonderful room! king bed with canopy, deep red loveseat, coffee table, armour with tv in it, desk, lotsa well built-in drawers, wet bar with small fridge, wood floors with small beautiful rugs, coffee pot, step-down shower, beautiful drapes. bathroom is up two stairs from floor level. room cold when we got in, and the thermostat is a black knob in which you can't tell what the selections are. we filled the tub about 5" full of all hot water until we ran out of hot water, but it was a treat even for a few minutes. hotel is 2-2-2: 2 blocks from bourbon street, french market, and jackson square. everything was fine there. very clean room, romantic, quiet, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Chateau”
Reviews.Author: Sandywhitebeaches
Reviews.Content: My husband & I along with another couple stayed here last weekend. We had rooms 240 & 241 that share a semi-private courtyard. The rooms also connected on the inside. The 240 room is a little smaller. We were in 241. It has a nice size foyer & sitting area. The room is a nice size with a very comfortable king bed. The bathroom was large with double vanity with a large mini fridge & closet is in there also. We all enjoyed the privacy of the courtyard that we had. It has a table & 4 chairs & a lounge chair. There is a small fountain & a lot of plants. This area is behind the bar in the large courtyard area. In the mornings they serve pastries & muffins, coffee & juice. It is simple, but enough to get you going. All of the staff were very friendly & helpful. They give maps & have restaurant recommendations. They were very personable. The location is perfect. The parking is excellent. The secured parking lot is across the street & is left unlocked during the day if you need to get your vehicle & the rate is $16.00 a day. The check in & out was very easy & no waiting on the car. If you want the ambience of New Orleans & the courtyard surroundings this is the place. If you want very fancy this is not the place. I would love to stay @ the Chateau again!

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two hotels”
Reviews.Author: London_Blue_TX
Reviews.Content: After having already made reservations at this hotel a few months in advance, I decided to take a look at the reviews on tripadvisor. I wasn't thrilled to see such extreme reviews - either really negative or really good. After staying there for 2 nights, now I know why. Night 1: We checked in with our friends and were given rooms 108 and 109 on the Chartres side of the hotel. We each had a wall facing the street. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because it wasn't near any major bars, any restaurants and was in a fairly quiet looking area of the quarter. However, at night we could hear the horse-drawn carriages going by every hour and the tour guides going through their scripts. We could hear people having loud conversations pretty much all night long and then there was the 6am trash pickup, the hour long dog barking before the owner finally shut it up and the hammering by a neighbor at o'dark thirty in the AM. None of us got a good night's sleep and were miserable. Night 2: We asked for a new room since the first one was so terrible and got rooms 241 and 239. These rooms were much better and were nothing like the rooms we had the first night. We had hardwood floors, brass four-poster beds and a sitting area. The bathroom was much larger and we had a dry bar with a mini fridge. The beds didn't have a sink hole in the center and we couldn't hear any street noise so all of us got a good night's sleep. The difference in these 2 sets of rooms was like night & day! Now I know why some people put such horrible reviews about it and why some thought it was great. When booking here, be sure to ask for an interior room, one that doesn't have a wall facing Chartres or St Philip. When we checked in, the desk attendant wasn't very friendly, but the person we met that had the night shift was very pleasant. They offer breakfast which we took advantage of only once and it was pretty standard, nothing special but did the trick. The dish TV doesn't get great reception, but you don't usually spend too much time watching it anyway. The shower pressure even varied between the two rooms, 239 and 241 had better water pressure. You can't book online and have to send them a check for the first night and wait for a confirmation to be snail-mailed to you since they won't take a credit card for reservations, although you can pay with a credit card upon arrival. It's close to everything in the quarter and there's a quaint 24 hr pub about a block away that's pretty quiet and they offer nightly ghost tours. My main advice about this hotel: book at your own risk - it's rather hit or miss depending on the room you end up with. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Plaid
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to have a girls-only weekend away to celebrate our birthdays. We did a little research on where to stay -- our priorities were a place we'd feel safe, a place that wouldn't cost a fortune, and a place with parking. Although we paid more for the room than we had hoped, this hotel seemed to have competitive rates with others in the area. We liked that it was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see in the Quarter, and was within walking distance to the streetcar line, which would give us access to almost everything we wanted to see outside the Quarter. Really, it was the parking and the location that put this hotel at the top of the list. (Parking costs extra unless you're a member of AAA.) We had a wonderful room that was larger than I expected. The porter told us the tv remote was quirky and that he'd fix it, but we told him not to bother -- we were there to see the sites, not to watch tv! The tub in the bathroom was too small to use as a bathtub, but it was a nice size for a shower. We had a shared balcony that overlooked the courtyard where the pool was located and where breakfast was served each morning. The man who worked the front desk in the mornings always seemed sleepy and like he didn't know what we were saying, but everyone else -- from the folks who worked the front desk, to the porters, to the parking attendants -- everyone was very pleasant and very helpful. They suggested restaurants, gave us maps and directions, and were knowledgeable about what places had re-opened since Katrina. They were really great. (Sleepy guy wasn't unpleasant; he just wasn't particular helpful.) Overall, we really enjoyed our time at the Chateau Hotel. The atmosphere was wonderful and relaxing. We loved hanging out around the pool in the the courtyard before bedtime. The location was perfect, and we didn't have to worry about the car. We hope to go back and take the guys with us next time.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Nola!”
Reviews.Author: missnmsy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel numerous times but this was my first time since the storm.The staff esp. Wendall the bell boy/chef. He always goes above and beyond for us.The entire staff is VERY helpful and I love them all. Our room was exactly what I wanted.The room was clean and comfy. As far as roaches go I've never seen one at the Chateau but I stayed at a VERY much more pricier hotel in Nola and one was looking at me when I woke up! Hey it's NOLA............what do you expect? As for the girls and the haunted penthouse--it IS haunted!! I know it is but hey again it's NOLA.God Bless that beautiful hotel and city!Don't forget the people waiting on you hand and foot perhaps live with 5 other people in a FEMA trailer. Please give them a break already! Be generous and tip a lot too!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tour1252
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here quite a few time over the years and absolutely enjoy seeing the same faces when we arrive. Wendell is incredible, he seems to do almost everything in and around the hotel. Everyone pitches in, as it is a small family establishment. This is the perfect little boutique hotel situated in the residental area of the French Quarter, but only 2 blocks from Jackson sqaure and Bourbon Street. You'll be made to feel as though you are part of the family. On this trip we brought our 2 daughters 17 and 14 along with us. They completely enjoyed being in New Orleans. The staff was friendly and helpful as usual. This is not a new hotel with all the bells and whistles, but it is a place where you can relax and enjoy the simple pleasures that make the French Quarter what it truly is. The rooms run from rather small to quite large, so ask before you book and you'll be confident you'll get what you need. The property is clean and a continental breakfast is served every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Traci09
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a weekend stay at the Chateau. Bobby at the front desk does look a bit gruff, but I think he's just misunderstood :-) Once engaged in conversation, he is very helpful. The only bellman is really a jack of all trades... he's moving bags, hailing cabs, serving the coffe and danish, taking people to their rooms and who knows what else!. Poor guy works 16 hrs a day on the weekends, but always said hello and goodbye and how's eveything. Our room, on the street side, was small but very nice and clean. Our king size bed was comfy and the pillows were very fluffy! Not a roach in sight. I will say that Sunday am when the garbage truck AND street cleaner came past there was a rumble, but Chartres is a few blocks from Bourbon, so that's the only noise we heard. We did get a newspaper each day at our door. The free continental breakfast consists of danish, muffins, coffee and juice. Sitting in the couryard enjoying the morning is a nice way to start your day. The Ritz it ain't... it is a very quaint hotel that we would have no trouble going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bntLouisiana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in early-March of 2007. I was eight months pregnant and it was our last chance to travel for a while so we thought we would get away to New Orleans for the weekend. I have family there so we go several times a year, so we aren't traditional tourists...we know our way around pretty well. The location of this hotel was wonderful, just a couple of blocks from the market and Cafe Du Monde. Unfortunately that was the only thing it had going for it. There were two men who alternated the front desk position, and neither of them were friendly. Trying to get our car out of the garage was a huge hassle, even though we asked their policy when we checked in, and called and gave them plenty of notice they were very rude about it. Our room was very disappointing. Run down and the only window was in the door, and the blinds didn't fully cover it so you felt like anyone could look in at any minute. However, the worst part would be the roaches; we killed several huge ones. I woke up to find one on my pillow! When my husband went to talk to the man at the front desk, he basically said it's a historic property and to get over it..there was nothing they could do. I feel like they use this "historic property" excuse to tourists but I don't buy it. That's why you should have a pest service. Needless to say we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Parking!”
Reviews.Author: hmcrn2
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for the Mardi Gras Marathon weekend (the weekend after Mardi Gras). What a perfect location! You are just two blocks from Jackson Square, two blocks from Bourbon St, and three blocks from the Outdoor Market. The hotel is in a quiet section, but plenty of restaurants and bars within a few blocks. This is an older hotel with a true New Orleans touch. (If you want super clean, new, plush - this isn't it.) We had a room on the ground floor facing the courtyard. Our two friends were upstairs in a room facing the street with a little balcony. They said there was some street noise, but not enough to wake you. Our room was comfortable, king bed (lots of pillows), love seat, and desk with chair. Bathroom is pretty small with a (no kidding) 21/2 foot tub. Weird. Shower was ok, but the hot water is not steady. A small closet is in the bathroom. The tv is old, but worked fine. A small refrigerator was under the desk. The courtyard area outside the room was wonderful. The breakfast is served at a bar in the courtyard in the morining. It was so nice to sit at the little tables and read the local paper (provided on the doorstep quite early), and sip coffe. The breakfast is just coffee, juice, and pastries, but was adequate to get me going. The pool is lovely for a quick dip, but not big enough to actually swim. It was clean and cool. The courtyard has an exit/entrance to the street so you don't have to come/go through the lobby. That was nice. They secure the gate at night, so very safe. A BIG PLUS with this hotel besides the location is the FREE parking! It's in a gate secured lot across the street. We went in and out several times very easily. The other good thing is the help. All very friendly, easy to talk to, great with maps and suggestions for meals. We had booked the hotel through AAA, and there was a mixup with the room, but was very quickly fixed by the staff. No complaints there. We will definatelly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Istayedthere
Reviews.Content: Great location, only minutes from the major sites such as Bourbon Street, Cafe du Monde, etc, and great choice of excellent restaurants nearby. Very friendly helpful staff. BUT, even in October the quite small room was so hot and stuffy. The windows could not be opened, and the room needed a good makeover and a spring clean. We dropped something on the floor that rolled under the TV cabinet - it was very dusty by the time it had been retrieved. The shower took about 20 minutes to go from freezing to scolding and the main light didn't work. Every TV channel was in a shade of pink. The bottle opener on the wall in the bathroom (?) looked as if it had been painted over on several occasions. We made our excuses and checked out after one night instead of two. I notice that the previous review was in 2003 so don't know if this has any bearing on the difference of opinion. A good makeover could make this into a superb hotel in a great location, but this did not live up to the expectations of a hotel named the "Chateau".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: ILroadtripper
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Motor Hotel was wonderful. It is a quaint little Inn. We stayed in room 223 and loved it. The room was a little small and the shower was tiny, but the bed was the best, very comfortable. We had a balcony with chairs to sit out on and a small bistro table. The hotel is close to everything, yet a few blocks from Burbon St. so the noise is not bad. I would recommend it to family and friends. The hotel seems more aimed toward adults and older youth. Not very kid friendly. The staff was wonderful, true southern hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: motherof6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau Hotel from July 4-7, 2006. The hotel is in a super location: three blocks from Jackson Square, two blocks from Bourbon Street and French Market. The property is old, but remember that you are in the French Quarter and call it charming instead of run-down. Our room overlooked the courtyard which has a fountain and swimming pool. The room was small, and needed a good paint job and new carpet - but who spends a lot of time in the room? The beds were heaven - actually the most comfortable hotel bed we've ever had. The staff was friendly and helpful. We come to New Orleans every year, and we will stay at the Chateau from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Chateau”
Reviews.Author: pharrisslo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a night at the Chateau and we both really enjoyed it. The location is perfect for walking to everything in the French Quarter as well as over to Frenchman St. for music in the evening. Our room was rather small, but clean and comfortable. The courtyard and the pool area were beautiful and well-kept. It felt like a little piece of old New Orleans and we both wished we could have stayed longer. The price was right, too! If you're not looking for glitz and room service, and appreciate the charm of a hotel "of a certain age"--you will not be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Post Katrina Update”
Reviews.Author: Tara79
Reviews.Content: My party and I stayed at the Chateau for Mardi Gras this year. This was our second stay and because it was a special occasion we upgraded. I am happy to say that we were very pleased. The room was spaciouse (even with all of our beads on the floor) and clean. I loved spending every morning on the balcony soaking in the sun and sounds while sipping my coffee. I spoke with the staff at the hotel and they stated that the hotel recieved very minimal damage and I saw no signs of any problems. I do not beleive the parking is free any longer though. We had a slight mix up as we were leaving about it so you may need to ask when you make your reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been perfect ...except for front desk lady”
Reviews.Author: cjviking17
Reviews.Content: I love the Chateau ,it has the charm and location that is the perfect New Orleans dream...however the front desk needs some help. We were accommodated in a beautiful room the first night but then had to move us to another the second. We were disappointed in the second room,dingy ,one bed was broken!We went down to civilly and calmly express our disappointment and see if there was anything else that could be done.The extremely defensive ,combative,and rude lady at the front desk shrieked and said if we didn't like it we could leave! I was very angry at our treatment...the desk clerk at checkout apologized but it really put a damper on what would have been a great evening.Thank God the rest of the French Quarter was friendly and welcoming.We also had a scratch on the bumper of our rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with the Chateau”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Chateau for the price, convenience and the NO experience. The rooms are nice and clean with comfy beds, high ceilings and balconies. The staff is great too. There's a nice restaurant right across the street called Mama's Kitchen? (or something like that) to get some breakfast before you tour the quarter (they also have excellent Shrimp Remoulade!).

Reviews.Title: “Twice pleased”
Reviews.Author: Zukiguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 11 years ago and had some concerns about not being as pleased the second time around. Not a problem. Still loved it. Staff was nice. Room was clean and well sized. Location is great. Short walk to most of the Quarter. A few notes though: 1.This part of town is old, don't expect things to be perfect. 2. Most of the hotels in the Quarter are old homes. If you want a room with a view, ask for one when you make your reservations. It may cost more, but it's well worth it. 3. When visiting the Qurter, remember it's history. Things are a little more carefree there and always have been. Let your hair down and enjoy that atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “vacationed New Orleans styl”
Reviews.Author: morafamily4
Reviews.Content: The Chateau is exactly what you would expect to find in the French Quater. The courtyard is true to the local architecture, and the pool although small was attractive with hibiscus planters and a small pond. The rooms are all different, the decor varies in each room. Our room was standard, had a king sized wrought iron bed, with a 15 foot high celing. The continental breakfast is chosen on a menu card that we placed on our door, choices included toast, muffins, danish and assorted juices coffee or tea. We even requested the time we wanted breakfast, then the hotel staff deliver it to your room on a tray. There are tables around the pool if you wish to eat alfresco, the service from all the houskeeping staff was excellent. Our room was located on the corner of the hotel, and the horse drawn carriages could be heard throughout the night. The bed was comfortable and clean. The charm of the hotel comes from its character earned through age, and if you are looking for sparkling new this is not the place for you. We found that it added the N"awlins flavour to our trip, and we would stay at the Chateau again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “The Charm of "Old" New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Fran0812
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Chateau for our anniversary. The room was well appointed and clean. Each morning we lingered on the balcony with our complimentary breakfast and the newspaper which were delivered directly to our room. The staff made us feel truly special with their outstanding service. Parking was also included in the reasonable rates. We are from the greater New Orleans area and plan to have many more weekend getaways there.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Chateau”
Reviews.Author: joe210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chateau Hotel for 2 nights recently and had a great time. Parking was a little confusing; I had to drop my wife off at the front to go in and ask where we were supposed to park. Thankfully a nice gentleman came out and directed me, unloaded our bags and parked our car in a secure lot. The front desk clerk gave us a map of the French Quarter, suggested several different places to go, and even booked our reservations at Emeril's NOLA for us. It is true that the rooms are small and somewhat "shabby", but our room was clean and the bed was quite comfortable. There is a small pool in the courtyard that was great for escaping the afternoon heat. The hotel is in a great location; very close to Jackson Square and the French Market area, and within short walking distance to all of the nightlife. All in all, this is a terrific value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy feel at the Chateau”
Reviews.Author: tyjo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a quick trip to New Orleans, my first trip there. I had considered a B&B, but decided that staying in the French Quarter was the way to go. I was right, the Chateau is close to everything, and has free parking, a real plus. True, the rooms are "shabby chic", but so is the whole area...that's the charm of New Orleans. The pool was a real treat after a day of walking and shopping, and the "minimal" breakfast was just fine, after all you want room for all that great food. The staff was helpful and directed us to some great restaurants and the Central Grocery for a real muffelata...if you're looking for the real feel of the city, try the Chateau.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!!!! Recommend it to anyone who is staying in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed at the Chateau Motor Hotel was April 1976. That was when my wife and I got married and we spent our honeymoon in New Orleans. Don't remember how we ended up there, but it was a great place to stay. Over the past 29 years we have stayed at the Chateau whenever we are in the New Orleans area. The management is always willing to go the extra mile for their customer's. If you are going to New Orleans, Lousiana, I highly recommend the Chateau Motor Hotel as the place to stay. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went for Jazz Festival was staying at another location not real happy there. We walked into this hotel and had to stay here. We had room 239 which they called the honeymoon suite very large and huge step down shower. The staff was wonderful and Wendel the doorman was the BEST. He was so friendly and had a smile on his face each time we met him. He as well as the hotel are JEMS in the big easy town of New Orleans. Will go back and stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: euscarol
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a spring break stay at the Chateau Hotel in the french quarter located at 1001 Chartres. Reserved a two room suite for $450 a night. One room was downstairs and the other was a loft bedroom with a bathroom. Very large in size and spacious. Kitchen has refrigerator and microwave oven. Stove was not working and we were told they don't want people cooking in the room. Suite was right across the street from an irish pub. The pub had music blaring straight into our suite until 4-5am every morning. Needless to say we got no sleep. In addition, the buggies with horses carrying people trot by nonstop throughout the day and night. One of the drivers told us that this building was the first morgue in New Orleans. The floors were extremely dirty. We wore socks and they were black after five minutes walking around. The amenities were not what you would expect when paying $450 a night. The toilet paper and tissue were like sand paper. The towels were hard. The housekeeping staff didn't show up until we called. Even then we were told that they were too busy doing check outs and couldn't come until after 4pm. The contitnental breakfast that was included wasn't too great either. It's a bread item and orange juice. The danish tasted stale. The pool looks inviting but is not heated. My family froze in the pool. It's close to things in the quarter but it's extremely noisy all night long and not clean. I don't recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Splendor”
Reviews.Author: TexasGrape
Reviews.Content: If you want every thing to be new and spotless then go to one of the chain hotels where every room is a clone of the other rooms. I love the Chateau Motor Hotel and have stayed there many times. Yes, some of the rooms have carpet or furniture that has seen better days but it's very clean and it's in keeping with the whole New Orleans vibe....a little old, a little shabby, a little quirky, but very heavy on atmosphere. The buildings themselves and the beautiful courtyard, along with the great location and price make up for any drawbacks of the rooms. If you want a perfect room then spend a little more and go for one of the suites, they're cheaper than a regular room in most of the other hotels in the Quarter. I've never been treated rudely by any of the staff and can't imagine that they ever would be rude. However I have seen them put someone in their place, and deservedly so, when that person tried to cut in line in front of another customer.

Reviews.Title: “"Rude" Might Be Too Weak A Term”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll second the review of the Front desk staff. I also stayed at the Chateau last summer with my two children. The staff was incredibly rude to me and other guests if you dared to ask them a question. The only time I have ever seen guests treated so badly was perhaps in New York and I really think the Chateau staff was worse. The valet and maids were exceedingly polite and our room was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly rude front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Years Eve 2004-2005 and beyond. Their Website totally exaggarates the ambiance. You will be disappointed. Our furniture was broken, plumbing bad, and lights out.Though the hotel is NOT well maintained, damp, and claustrophobic: this does not begin to compare to the rudeness, condescending manner, and just plain lack of helpfulness from the front desk staff we encountered. Whether day or night, the person(s) at the front desk wanted nothing to do with you. The housekeeping and security staff were just the opposite however (kind and caring); perhaps they should switch roles ! One of our party took seriously ill during our stay (later requiring hospitalization). When asked for help in placing a phone call, even reheating some food for this person, we were rudely dismissed and ignored with a scowl. Upon checking out, we witnessed a phone conversation whereupon the desk clerk yelled at the caller, told them it was "not his job" and hung up ! This is not the Hospitality industry I expected in New Orleans ! I will be writing a letter to the Hotels owners though I am not sure if it will make it past the front desk staff. Overall, a terrible stay here at the Chateau...though New Orleans, the City, is incredible ! Avoid the Chateau !

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in the whole world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just wrote a message to someone in a forum telling them to stay here. I love this place, it is classic New Orleans, located right in the French Quarter. We always manage to get the same room, one overlooking Chartres street, with a wrought-iron balcony so we can eat the free continental breakfast outside in the morning. This hotel is very charming, and has the New Orleans look: a sort of run-down, faded luxury in keeping with its setting. The rooms are very nice without being artificial, and the beds are comfortable. The staff is friendly, it's centrally located, they have parking, and you're surrounded by some of the best restaurants in the world. In ten minutes you can walk to the french market or Cafe Du Monde. This hotel is classy, charming, and exceedingly proper.

Reviews.Title: “Very suprised.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June of 2004, I originally had reservations for four nights. I ended up arriving in New Orleans a day early so I called the hotel hoping I could check into my room on that day. The room that I had reserved was occupied so they put me in a smaller room for the first night. This room did not have any windows which I was not use to and I wouldn't recommend to anyone. Part of New Orleans is being able to take in the atmosphere and you just cant do that in a room with no view. The remainder of my stay was in a room with windows and a walk out that looked over the court yard and pool. The room was very clean and spacious. they supplied breakfast delivered to your room only cost of a tip which you decided to give or not. The staff was very friendly and very helpful, making reservations for me and guiding me to various areas that I wanted to see and also areas they recommended I not go into at certain hours. I would recommend this hotel, it is in an excellent area in the quarter, the only thing I'd say is when making reservations ask for a room with windows and or a balcony.

HotelInfo.Name: Chateau Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1001 Chartres St, New Orleans, LA 70116
